commit_message:
blueprint migrate-to-diskimage-builder

Incorporated code review comments
- removed IDE specific values from .gitignore
- moved SSH Key creation into redstack/functions_qemu script
- removed dead files
- added GUEST_USERNAME if needed to override (otherwise inherits host username)
- cleaned up MySQL startup so that it does not start initially

Added "elements" directory which contains the parts to build a reddwarf-guest and reddwarf-mysql image
Modified "redstack" so that it installs diskimage-builder and copies elements to diskimage-builder directory (temp workaround)
Modified "redstack.rc" to point to diskimage-builder repository
Modified "functions_qemu" to replace ubuntu vm builder with diskimage-builder

Change-Id: Ifd6a28d94b3cc8d4d8dc6792d5db48b6ec57004d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-14 17:58:47.000000000', 'message': 'Implement importutils.try_import.

Adds a new (simple) importutils.try_import function which
can return a module name or a default (by default this is None).

This should help clean up some of our

try:
    import foo
except...

blocks in modules.

This commit also drops the dependency on python-extras which is
no longer needed.

Fixes LP Bug #1099501.

Change-Id: I8591f79983bdad67a50d1aaae6dce8428dfce084
'}]
commit_message:
Implement importutils.try_import.

Adds a new (simple) importutils.try_import function which
can return a module name or a default (by default this is None).

This should help clean up some of our

try:
    import foo
except...

blocks in modules.

This commit also drops the dependency on python-extras which is
no longer needed.

Fixes LP Bug #1099501.

Change-Id: I8591f79983bdad67a50d1aaae6dce8428dfce084

Use 'nosetests --with-doctests' to run any doctests found. We currently
only use doctests in a handful of places, but we may as well run them
to ensure they work.

Make the cfg doctests avoid using the global CONF since we would need
to reset its state between each doctest.

Fix the cliutils doctests to actually pass.

Use 'nosetests --exclude-dir=tests/testmods' to avoid loading the
modules from this dir while discovering doctests. The cfg unit tests
rely on these modules not having been previously loaded.

commit_message:
Make tox run doctests

Use 'nosetests --with-doctests' to run any doctests found. We currently
only use doctests in a handful of places, but we may as well run them
to ensure they work.

Make the cfg doctests avoid using the global CONF since we would need
to reset its state between each doctest.

Fix the cliutils doctests to actually pass.

Use 'nosetests --exclude-dir=tests/testmods' to avoid loading the
modules from this dir while discovering doctests. The cfg unit tests
rely on these modules not having been previously loaded.

Change-Id: I19ad70767fa5c8352b994dc963b5d3a7c9d9eb95

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-14 09:05:06.000000000', 'message': "Allow rpc drivers to always be imported

The qpid and zmq drivers current can't be import unless their
respective libraries are installed and neither are currently listed
in test-requires.

This prevents us from being able to use nosetests --with-doctests
because the import failure is seen as a test failure.

Fix this issue by making the import always succeed and deferring
failure until the module's APIs are actually used.

This will also help Nova's sample config file generation since it
will allow the generate-sample tool discover config options for these
drivers even when the messaging libraries aren't installed.

Change-Id: I30087fd33eef41d50d1a374cb5694dc15c43d1da

commit_message:
Allow rpc drivers to always be imported

The qpid and zmq drivers current can't be import unless their
respective libraries are installed and neither are currently listed
in test-requires.

This prevents us from being able to use nosetests --with-doctests
because the import failure is seen as a test failure.

Fix this issue by making the import always succeed and deferring
failure until the module's APIs are actually used.

This will also help Nova's sample config file generation since it
will allow the generate-sample tool discover config options for these
drivers even when the messaging libraries aren't installed.

Change-Id: I30087fd33eef41d50d1a374cb5694dc15c43d1da

commit_message:
Remove extras dependency with a partial oslo sync.

Only service.py and importutils.py have been synchronized.

This change is a blocker for producing g-2 rpms

Change-Id: I692a8f6c9948a7aa75a2f6db7657d6c72e09a772

commit_message:
Rework zmq setup and cleanup

Register config options at import time and remove the register_opts()
function. It seems this isn't being used.

Add accessor methods for ZMQ_CTXT and matchmaker so that they are
lazily created rather than created at import time.

Remove the rpc_zmq_matchmaker override in the tests since
MatchMakerLocalhost is the default anyway. We were setting it with
an incorrect value, but only after the matchmaker had already been
created.

Change-Id: I2520252c64d70e4c4903e34d07952fed43e70ebe

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-15 10:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-15 19:30:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What special characters are you trying to allow here? Please provide a specific example, or I may revert this patch as it's a potential security hole.

This review escaped the review process inappropriately. Bugs should first be filed on launchpad (launchpad.net/horizon) for triage, review, and tracking purposes. They should then be reviewed by at least two people other than the original author and preferably approved by two core reviewers. Reviews by the author of the patch don't count, sorry. ;-)

The real problem with this patch is that it's a classic opening for an injection attack. I name my tenant:

    '"; sudo rm -rf /'

and suddenly your openrc file asks you for your password and deletes everything. The example may be contrived, but that's the gist. You should never use the |safe filter on any user-supplied value unless you've otherwise sanity-checked it.

So, as I said, please bring a stronger explanation for what you're trying to allow/accomplish here.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-01-15 20:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Reverted

This patchset was reverted in change: I9d3014f23ae4c8434dc4204a61ef2ac375176e73'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-01-15 20:12:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's a good catch too!

The thing is that without it horizon would change tenant names with some special characters like & (see testcase).

I guess that we could accept a set of those characters or just don't accept any of them and keep it without |safe, so no special characters for tenant names.

Let's keep track of this here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19740/"}]

commit_message:
Horizon escapes special characters in openrc.sh

Adding the safe filter makes it possible to have tenant names with
special charaters rendered into the openrc.sh file without escaping
those characters.

Added a new unittest for templates

Change-Id: I56ec047da467b721bd1b57d2c97d05717e83f468

commit_message:
Revert "Horizon escapes special characters in openrc.sh"

This reverts commit 3a9b0da489030eaacc6cc0416f92192b74783ac8

That's a good catch too!

The thing is that without it horizon would change tenant names with some special characters like & (see testcase).

I guess that we could accept a set of those characters or just don't accept any of them and keep it without |safe, so no special characters for tenant names.

I' reverting this change so we can find a better solution for this.

commit_message:
Add 'devname' to nova.network.model.VIF class

Add a 'devname' field to nova.network.model.VIF to allow network
drivers to specify a desired TAP device name. Update the Quantum
driver to set a device name, and update the libvirt VIF drivers
to honour it.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: Ia8dd546af36e7f6c22efd7c696fb58b37aac0061
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

There are 2 changes here:

commit_message:
minor improvements to nova/tests/test_metadata.py

There are 2 changes here:
 a.) previously we checked for existance of 'user-data' in
     a response, when it clearly would not have been there as
     the key name is 'user_data'.
 b.) Insist that top level keys in the openstack metadata do not have '-'.
     This is just a consistency thing.  Its very easy for someone to
     unintentionally add a key named 'my-field'.  We want to enforce
     keys to be named consistently using '_' rather than -.
     For reference, current keys are:
       files uuid availability_zone hostname meta public_keys name

Change-Id: Ia73050c5313b3524dd1d341528cc5f916e603c64

[{'created': '2013-01-10 16:25:45.000000000', 'message': "When logging request include request data

When the --debug flag is used it should print out the body of a POST
request.  It did that previously but the kwargs dict used for the
request stopped using 'body' which is what the logging relied on.  This
changes it to use 'data' which is a string representation of what was in
'body'.

Bug 1098241

Change-Id: I82f36e59b459706d9d5a3a38563a45c80e84c6e2
"}]
commit_message:
When logging request include request data

When the --debug flag is used it should print out the body of a POST
request.  It did that previously but the kwargs dict used for the
request stopped using 'body' which is what the logging relied on.  This
changes it to use 'data' which is a string representation of what was in
'body'.

Bug 1098241

Change-Id: I82f36e59b459706d9d5a3a38563a45c80e84c6e2

commit_message:
Add support for instance evacuate.

This adds support for server evacuation from failed host.
Adds CLI command:

nova evacuate <server> <host> [--password pwd] [--on-shared-storage]

Depends on the approval of change:
https://review.openstack.org/#change,17991

Change-Id: Icd91c0484b2db532861e23163d043737ad04117a

commit_message:
Fix the help text of add-fixed-ip

Makes the help text of the add-fixed-ip less confusing by pointing out
that the IP address is taken from the given network and assigned to the
server.

Change-Id: Iaf4641f65a5872ee70273d5b972ff5da0ddd7b1d

commit_message:
Move from untitest2 to testtools.

Use testtools as the base testclass. Use fixtures library for managing
fixtures.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Iac5af286b988787acf7049344641aadf140b9398

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-01 20:44:06.000000000', 'message': "For quotas and resize and cells: commit reservations immediately for now

There's not an immediate good solution for quotas on resize with cells
due to how it's implemented.  Will have to revisit this with a better
patch later.  This can lead to some out-of-sync issues when deleting
things in certain resize states... or if there are resize errors.

Store migration information on API cell to correctly handle quotas

Revert and confirm of migrations require access to migration information
so they can calculate the reservation correctly. For new resizes, store
a migration record locally so it can be used later on. For old resizes,
keep the previous behavior (for now).

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

Change-Id: I356600d1d0d9408b019a9422f795b4244c252052

so they can calculate the reservation correctly. For new resizes, store
a migration record locally so it can be used later on. For old resizes,
keep the previous behavior (for now).

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

commit_message:
Cells: Commit resize quota reservations immediately

There's not an immediate good solution for quotas on resize with cells
due to how it's implemented.  Will have to revisit this with a better
patch later.  This can lead to some out-of-sync issues when deleting
things in certain resize states... or if there are resize errors.

Store migration information on API cell to correctly handle quotas

Revert and confirm of migrations require access to migration information
so they can calculate the reservation correctly. For new resizes, store
a migration record locally so it can be used later on. For old resizes,
keep the previous behavior (for now).

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

Change-Id: I356600d1d0d9408b019a9422f795b4244c252052

commit_message:
Adds tenant network support to the client

Modifies novaclient, changing the existing networks implementation to a
more appropriate os-admin-networks namespace, and supplements with a
tenant-base network extenion that lives under the os-networks namespace
as a Nova API extension. Also removes from the duplicately named network
test methods.

Implements: blueprint tenant-networks

Change-Id: I54c9f017b86fc413f1646c7bded8cebd94f6a287

commit_message:
More HostAPI() cleanup for cells.

This patch contains further changes needed to support HostAPI() with
cells.  This moves the formatting of hosts API extension responses back
to the extension itself.  Methods for getting service entries have been
added to HostAPI() that can be overriden in a subclass for cells.

Also contains a performance improvement for 'show' in hosts extension.

Change-Id: Ifd8b68ff8d7495f537dff5e01bd3df75c6c5930a

commit_message:
Populate service list with availability zone and correct unit test

Availability zone was removed from the service object and is now added
via a separate call to availabilty_zones.set_availability_zones. Fix
the fake_services_list structure in test_services to reflect that
availability zone is no longer returned but added separately based
on the topic.

NOTE: original fix was reverted, combining unit test fix and original
change here.

bug 1099399
Change-Id: Ic9675a88c2c229d6feb20f5b934458e10c17684f

commit_message:
Move network call from compute API to the manager

reboot gets network info from the network manager in the API only to pass
it to the manager.  This causes an un-needed delay on the API call.  It
also causes issues with cells, as with cells you should query the network
service close to that cell.

Fixes bug 1098741

Change-Id: If6badc007ad812e5539a3738911011685cf9df35

commit_message:
Make sure reboot_instance uses updated instance

compute manager's reboot_instance() was doing a check on a stale version
of instance['power_state'] as well as passing stale instance data to the
driver and notification calls.

Fixes bug 1098727

Change-Id: I59f12f09d6e8a364e65f53912c09132a249c88c0

commit_message:
Renames the new os-networks extension

Merging the new os-networks extension upstream broke what was considered
a 'released' extension. This patch returns everything to normal and
renames the os-networks extension to os-tenant-networks

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint tenant-networks

Change-Id: I04b17d08c5760fd73736124b36cab0d383767020

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-13 19:14:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix zmq socket.close() with eventlet >0.9.14

A bug/change in eventlet >0.9.14 blocks the
kwargs from close() from passing through
to pyzmq. As this code was only explicitly
passing defaults, no argument is necessary.

This addresses file descriptor leaks reported
in bug 1099185.

The code will now log an error if a socket
cannot be closed.

Change-Id: Id438dab9744042328b7fac44693d02e116d8c1d9
'}, {'created': '2013-01-13 20:53:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix zmq socket.close() with eventlet >0.9.17

A bug/change in eventlet >0.9.17 blocks the
kwargs from close() from passing through
to pyzmq. As this code was only explicitly
passing defaults, no argument is necessary.

This addresses file descriptor leaks reported
in bug 1099185. This bug does not affect
installations with eventlet<=0.9.16

The code will now log an error if a socket
cannot be closed.

Change-Id: Id438dab9744042328b7fac44693d02e116d8c1d9
'}, {'created': '2013-01-13 20:54:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix zmq socket.close() with eventlet 0.9.17

A bug/change in eventlet 0.9.17 blocks the
kwargs from close() from passing through
to pyzmq. As this code was only explicitly
passing defaults, no argument is necessary.

This addresses file descriptor leaks reported
in bug 1099185. This bug does not affect
installations with eventlet<=0.9.16

The code will now log an error if a socket
cannot be closed.

Change-Id: Id438dab9744042328b7fac44693d02e116d8c1d9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix zmq socket.close() with eventlet 0.9.17

A bug/change in eventlet 0.9.17 blocks the
kwargs from close() from passing through
to pyzmq. As this code was only explicitly
passing defaults, no argument is necessary.

This addresses file descriptor leaks reported
in bug 1099185. This bug does not affect
installations with eventlet<=0.9.16

The code will now log an error if a socket
cannot be closed.

Change-Id: Id438dab9744042328b7fac44693d02e116d8c1d9

commit_message:
Don't include versioninfo in manifest.

We don't produce versioninfo files anymore, so don't try to include them
in the MANIFEST.in.

Change-Id: I00d8a61361cba73528a1ae780538a80ed1da2361

commit_message:
Adding multi switch support to the Cisco Nexus plugin

This commit adds intelligent multiple nexus physical switch support for the Cisco plugin.
The plugin also has been modified to scan for the host when an instance is created and
selectively trunk VLAN's for the port for that host only. It also deletes VLANs from nexus
switches when no longer required.

Implements: blueprint cisco-plugin-enhancements

Change-Id: I6275eb1815310d0d5a8123ca2edbc0a0937718e9

commit_message:
Update SolidFire Volume driver

Adds support for clone volumes and set QoS use volume type / extra_specs.
Also includes some minor cleanup and some hardening for known pre-release
XDB issue in SolidFire Cluster API.

Change-Id: I4b39b301b9a1f9b859a694decfee48c74d22a74a

commit_message:
Support for SSL in wsgi.Server

SSL are entirely optional. Support for SSL as well using code from glance. We
have some new options for configuring the SSL support. There are tests for
accessing a sample app w/o ipv6 or ssl, one with just ssl and one with
ipv6 and ssl

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9aa1db6c9563868bf68ced7c4311daa870216ced

commit_message:
Enhance wsgi to listen on ipv6 address

Check if the hostname is ipv6 and set the family appropriately.
Picking up the snippet from glance.
Picked up some code from nova as well to get the test case running
properly

[{'created': '2013-01-12 16:19:35.000000000', 'message': 'ensure setup_test_user has been called before using test_user

when tempest run in one process, setup_test_user can be called in
other tests. But when tempest run in multiple process, we should
ensure it has been called before using test_user in every test.

Part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: If5aadf0852c578fb198f49be3604d6cbe24155f9
'}]
commit_message:
ensure setup_test_user has been called before using test_user

when tempest run in one process, setup_test_user can be called in
other tests. But when tempest run in multiple process, we should
ensure it has been called before using test_user in every test.

Part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: If5aadf0852c578fb198f49be3604d6cbe24155f9

Yes, the script should probably be renamed. Maybe that could be done in combination with the flushing improvements (or going back to the old wrapper).'}]

[{'created': '2013-01-07 19:22:40.000000000', 'message': "Handle different cloud-init versions gracefully

Change loguserdata script to python to allow easy detection of which
version of cloud-init installed. Some logging was added to
part-handler.

Took out injecting the command to touch provision-finished in the user
data. This is now handled in loguserdata.py.

Note that up until cloud-init version 0.6.0, the user data is not
passed to part-handler. This behavior is why it's not possible to log
the provisioning process with older versions. (Technically could rely
on the redirection support added post 0.6.0, but having a separate
file just for provisioning seems beneficial.)

fixes bug 1072921

Change-Id: I9005a21bfb74f27208f9195a6e10e1d2b474e91f
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle different cloud-init versions gracefully

Change loguserdata script to python to allow easy detection of which
version of cloud-init installed. Some logging was added to
part-handler.

Took out injecting the command to touch provision-finished in the user
data. This is now handled in loguserdata.py.

Note that up until cloud-init version 0.6.0, the user data is not
passed to part-handler. This behavior is why it's not possible to log
the provisioning process with older versions. (Technically could rely
on the redirection support added post 0.6.0, but having a separate
file just for provisioning seems beneficial.)

fixes bug 1072921

Change-Id: I9005a21bfb74f27208f9195a6e10e1d2b474e91f
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ZeroMQ test should set correct matchmaker module

The matchmaker module was being set incorrectly
in test_zmq. This was working because the
variable was being used at the time of import
and this override was being ignored.

This change is necessary to support runtime
configuration and Mark's upcoming matchmaker/
context patch.

Change-Id: Id7f7e838f7aeb5dda9681825b711ee3488c811f6

commit_message:
heat engine : WaitCondition FnGetAtt return correct signal data

FnGetAtt for WaitCondition should return data in the format described

commit_message:
Remove error from httpd/apache on unstack.sh

Fedora/RHEL use httpd for the package name of httpd.  This is handled
in other parts of the horizon startup code, but not in shutdown.

Change-Id: I2732dad652d83a9cbe055f5f077678b7111ca782
Fixes: bug #1099538

commit_message:
Refactor rpc backend configuration logic

This commit also changes the following:
- Fixes Nova QPID module path
- Fixes a bug Cinder ZeroMQ RPC points to nova module
- Adds ZeroMQ setting for Heat RPC

qpid_is_supported is moved from functions to lib/rpc_backend.

This work is based on the work by Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19074/.

Change-Id: I45e21b1fb85e539213f5243764132a37906d7455

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-19 08:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18368/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/22964 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-19 21:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"router1" name is hard-coded.

I would prefer if the name->id resolution happen on the tempest side.

I would prefer if the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18369/1/etc/tempest.conf.sample contain
public_router_name = router1'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-19 22:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

afazekas: With respect, consider asking questions if something in a review doesn't make sense to you.  OpenStack is complicated, and I haven't found it useful to assume I know someone's intent unless I've recently worked on the same code.

Please note, given Sean and Dean's admonition that no further changes to stack.sh to support quantum will be accepted in advance of a refactor that externalizes such functionality, this change won't go in as-is anyway.

First issue - this change adds support for configuring a router that is publicly owned if namespaces are disabled.  Before this change, the router1 name is fixed.  This change does not change that behaviour and is not intended to - I would consider it out-of-scope.

Your second two issues are not related to this change - please respond on the review for the corresponding tempest change.   When you do, please consider the following:

- names are not guaranteed to be unique, but ids are.  when configuring tempest, the use of ids rather than names to identify resources is in general preferable to having to look up the name and potentially be returned multiple resources at test-time.

-  the default for public_router_id should be blank (as should public_network_id), but devstack's iniset will create new config entries above the blank ones, and the blank ones will win.  Adding fake values (as is used elsewhere in the sample conf) ensures that devstack can properly configure tempest.  Should iniset be fixed?  Of course.  But I'm working on the problem at hand - allow configuration of tempest - using the tools at hand using the approach already taken.  If you feel this is a problem, consider solving it at its root rather than -1'ing a patch that is entirely consistent with the existing codebase."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-19 22:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Name not unique . ok.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-19 22:22:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

(1 inline comment)

Why not create the router on the tempest side ?'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-19 22:56:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

afazekas: Tempest will create tenent-owned routers if namespaces are enabled, but the public router is a special case.  Many tempest tests rely on connectivity to vm's 'just working' and if a pre-configured public router is providing that connectivity, tempest should not manage that resource.  Remember that tempest isn't targeted solely at devstack deployments of openstack - a production deployment could be targeted as well, and having tempest modify critical resources seems unwise."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-19 23:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thank you.

I will fix the iniset. Looks like it has another bug too.
I wanted to improve it with new feature anyway.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-20 19:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-01-06 06:08:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-07 23:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zhongyue Luo: You may want to consider reading the review history before chiming in with your opinion.  As per a previous comment, this review is unlikely to go in as-is due to a requirement on the part of devstack core that quantum changes not be accepted to stack.sh in advance of a refactor to lib/quantum.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-01-08 01:13:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-10 08:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-10 09:02:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've created a new change for requested environment variable changes:  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19370

The latest patch builds on those fixes incorporates the requested changes."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-10 09:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-10 09:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18368/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/25772 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18368/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres/532 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/18368/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/970 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/18368/4/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/2411 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-10 09:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@afazekas

Let me clarify for later devstack update.
Do we need to define all variables referred to by multiple lib files in stackrc?

Defining Q_ROUTER_NAME in stackrc sounds reasonable to me since other network configurations such as PUBLIC/PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME are declared in stackrc.

On the other hand, moving Q_USE_NAMESPACE to stackrc results in a problem that quantum configurations are splitted into lib/quantum and stackrc. Now I am brushing up dependencies in lib/quantum and it is almost finished. As a part of the brush up, I have an idea to define a function is_quantum_use_namespace in lib/quantum. If so, lib/tempest just need to add lib/quantum to dependencies and there needs to be no dependency on Q_USE_NAMESPACES. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-01-10 11:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

@mnewby:

IMHO lib/quantum is for codes used by only the quantum services. 
The lib/services should avoid dependencies on each other when it is possible.
Not all quantum related code must be in lib/quantum, just the codes are relevant to quantum only.

You SHOULD declare variables used by multiple scripts in the stackrc, if they do not need any external command execution.
You also SHOULD use this file  when  expected to be overwritten (or declared earlier) by the localrc or by an environment variable.

You MAY declare variables in stack.sh, if they used by multiple library, and needs external commands, or other similar steps to be done earlier.
Goal would be not to grow this file, when it is possible. 

You MAY declare generic reusable functions in "functions". 

I do not think, just for single variable compare you need a function.

If the number of true/false configs increase significantly we might invent something similar to the ENABLED_SERVICES.

These are just my impressions, I might be wrong.

Thank you. Now it looks excellent.
 But I can't give higher score on devstack changes.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-10 13:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

@afazekas Thanks for the explanation. I totally agree with you.
@mnewby Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:08:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

To clarify how stackrc should be used:  it is for global configuration variables and things that need to be declared early so they can be referenced in localrc.

Project-specific configuration belongs in the project files.  In this case, that is why the inclusion of the quantum vars in tempest needs to be documented.

PUBLIC|PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME should probably go back to lib/quantum, I don't see a reason they are global config.

@afazekas, your description is pretty close, except for the stackrc 'SHOULD" section.  Shared vars that need to be referenced before they would be sourced in their project files should go into stackrc.  We have few, if any, of those for project-specific vars.  That is more of the rule I use for moving things from stack.sh itself into stackrc.  And that is usually so they can be dereferenced in localrc, like $DEST.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dean: Should lib/quantum really define PUBLIC_NETWORK_NAME and PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME?  Both nova network and quantum use these, depending on the devstack configuration.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Maru, to be honest, I thought that was the case but fat-fingered my grep to verify it.  You are correct, that is a good example of what should be in stackrc.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-01-11 15:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@dtroyer:

I recommended to put the project specific variables into the stackrc because you MAY touch the same variables in the localrc.

I assume from your other review response, generally we don't want environment variables, to take precedence, because you asked me for direct declararation.

I think variables expected optionally declared in localrc, should be enumerated somewhere. Probably the stackrc is the best place for that. And it is the best place to set the default value IMHO.

When you are searching for where is XYZ variable gets a value before on optional {:-} assignment, you find nothing otherwise.

Difficult to figure out is the {:-} done by a mistake, or a localrc declaration expected.

Anyway I think this change should pass, and we should discuss the variable declaration and cleanups on IRC.

I will help in making it consistent anyway, we just need to agree on something."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-01-12 19:39:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The parent to this was abandoned so it needs a rebase.  Move Q_ROUTER_NAME back to lib/quantum and we're good to go."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-14 21:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-14 21:33:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The latest patch addresses Dean's most recent comment - rebase and move Q_ROUTER_NAME to lib/quantum from stackrc."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-01-14 22:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Cool. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 4184, 'date': '2013-01-14 22:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Improve quantum l3 and tempest config.

 * Previously, configuration for the q-l3 agent was creating a
   tenant-owned router.  This change maintains that behaviour if
   namespaces are enabled, but creates a public (not tenant-owned)
   router if namespaces are disabled.  Since the L3 agent can only
   manage a single router if namespaces are disabled, the change
   ensures that the single router can be shared by multiple tenants.
 * Add tempest configuration for the public router.

Change-Id: I2878a7eb9797bfd71082a55d4773519dc5198abc

commit_message:
heat engine : Implement Count property for WaitCondition

The Count property of WaitCondition is currently ignored, so
regardless of the number specified the WaitCondition resource will
always go to CREATE_COMPLETE on the first WaitConditionHandle signal.
This patch fixes this so the Count property is handled correctly.

fixes bug 1097813

Change-Id: I71348c553702c0282a8826488c953ac3c2c76e38
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-01-15 09:23:40.000000000', 'message': 'Make "quantum help" to show a list of subcommands.

Fix bug 1023260

All other OpenStack clients (nova, keystone, glance, ....) accepts
just "help" which displays a list of subcommands. This commit makes
quantum command consist with other OpenStack projects.

After this change help behavior of quantum command becomes as follows:
Show general help message:
  quantum --help
  quantum help
Show help message of subcommand
  quantum help <subcommand>
  quantum <subcommand> --help

Change-Id: I34ca0df809da04f9b9b9275c697e6aafca312cfe
'}]
commit_message:
Make "quantum help" to show a list of subcommands.

Fix bug 1023260

All other OpenStack clients (nova, keystone, glance, ....) accepts
just "help" which displays a list of subcommands. This commit makes
quantum command consist with other OpenStack projects.

After this change help behavior of quantum command becomes as follows:
Show general help message:
  quantum --help
  quantum help
Show help message of subcommand
  quantum help <subcommand>
  quantum <subcommand> --help

Change-Id: I34ca0df809da04f9b9b9275c697e6aafca312cfe

commit_message:
reusable ZmqProxy service initialization

Move near-identical proxy setup code
from oslo-zmq-receiver and test_zmq
into ZmqProxy's consume_in_thread method

Provides code reuse and simplifies the
tests and receiver binary.

Change-Id: I1324eacfa2a456599d5fd462b6476ddf659e95c4

commit_message:
call() to accept serialize and force_envelope

The serialize and force_envelope options were
being stripped from call().

Now, when call() is invoked, these options
are passed and respected.

Change-Id: I69355606b06ab2ec87765fe6ddba7baaa68e5754

commit_message:
Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

bug 1092227

Change-Id: I44fdd11acbf1d5245e0c9c5a6199fd53200928ed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-15 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes deployment bug on Windows

Fixes bug: #1052161

Oslo contains an update to common/setup.py for Windows support,
specifically it uses cmd.exe instad of /bin/sh on Windows.

This is required to install Quantum on Windows and Hyper-V server.

In order to update a source belonging to Oslo, the documented procedure
has been followed, thus the large number of updated files in this patch
set:

git clone https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator
cd oslo-incubator
python update.py <path of Quantum repository>

Change-Id: I01a9e461371d10a6c69d167366369ed95c02aa00

commit_message:
Fixes deployment bug on Windows

Fixes bug: #1052161

Oslo contains an update to common/setup.py for Windows support,
specifically it uses cmd.exe instad of /bin/sh on Windows.

This is required to install Quantum on Windows and Hyper-V server.

In order to update a source belonging to Oslo, the documented procedure
has been followed, thus the large number of updated files in this patch
set:

git clone https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator
cd oslo-incubator
python update.py <path of Quantum repository>

Change-Id: I01a9e461371d10a6c69d167366369ed95c02aa00

'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-02 22:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-01-03 09:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-06 20:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The tricky bit here is that 1) it's not possible to say in all cases that they will be the same "danger" actions nor that they should be disabled for the same reasons since the actions may have different conditions in the "allowed" method; and 2) that this doesn't give the user any indication of why the table action is now disabled.

Thus far we've made due by letting them be selected en-masse and informing the user of the failure since that's a bit more descriptive. I agree that that's not ideal, but I think this solution only works by coincidence and doesn't offer enough feedback.

The more complete solution to this will be when we integrate Keystone's V3 policy API in and we can determine the user's permissions on each action properly.'}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-01-07 18:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I cannot (and will not) argue with this rationale, as it is quite reasonable.

But it bears repeating that the current behavior of Horizon, while it ends up doing the right thing, is actively confusing end-users.

This patch does commit the dual sins of "papering over the problem rather than fixing it" and "only working by accident/coincidence" but I figured it was a workable stopgap solution since the backend works correctly, and it's really only a problem with visualization.

But code quality is important, and you guys are the ones that will have to deal with this later, so if it's not the kind of thing you're going to want to ever see again, more the better.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-15 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-15 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Don't activate "dangerous" buttons if the users don't have write permissions

Takes advantage of the fact that "dangerous" actions also show up
in the pull-down menu in the same row as the checkbox when users
have proper rights.

Change-Id: I57d9d995fcc043de933408180e5d0816fa59ba3a
Fixes: Bug #1092647

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-15 02:01:16.000000000', 'message': 'Export the MAC addresses of nodes for bare-metal.

The bare-metal hypervisor needs to let the network layer know the MAC
address of each node it has, or TFTP boot will fail, as the MAC
addresses quantum / nova dynamically allocate will not match the
actual MAC of the node as it boots. This change exports the MAC
addresses to the manager, which passes them onto the network driver in
use.

With this change administrators should register all the MAC addresses
of a given node with Nova bare-metal as interfaces, even though that
may duplicate the MAC for PXE boot provisioning. Long term the
dedicated provisioning MAC address will be removed.

Change-Id: I55f6031294a2c5d31975462f868aa27441e11ad2

'}]
commit_message:
Export the MAC addresses of nodes for bare-metal.

The bare-metal hypervisor needs to let the network layer know the MAC
address of each node it has, or TFTP boot will fail, as the MAC
addresses quantum / nova dynamically allocate will not match the
actual MAC of the node as it boots. This change exports the MAC
addresses to the manager, which passes them onto the network driver in
use.

With this change administrators should register all the MAC addresses
of a given node with Nova bare-metal as interfaces, even though that
may duplicate the MAC for PXE boot provisioning. Long term the
dedicated provisioning MAC address will be removed.

Change-Id: I55f6031294a2c5d31975462f868aa27441e11ad2

commit_message:
Break out a helper function for working with bare metal nodes.

This makes it easier to get a bare metal internal node id when called
from the manager.

Change-Id: I1b39a7be5bd21d5b3060f11a74b9eaf79b107210

commit_message:
Document why RAID shouldn't be used with Swift

Based on an email from Chuck Thier on the OpenStack mailing list

https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg19633.html

Patchset subs comma for period (typo fix)

Rebase against master

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19256/

Change-Id: I3061d1bb61049da7eae1eb472872c995fd6d7131

commit_message:
Enhance wsgi to listen on ipv6 address

Check if the hostname is ipv6 and set the family appropriately.
Picking up the snippet from glance to determine the address family
Picked up some code from nova as well to get the test case running
properly

Change-Id: I747e05cfaf904364075135c83ef9be0601c3b13e

[{'created': '2013-01-15 03:00:49.000000000', 'message': 'ensure all enums in loadbalancer models have names

fixes bug 1099565

Postgres requires that enums types have names.  This fix adds the name
parameter to the Enum declaration.

Change-Id: Ica67c6cf0b8959761f3022552c1c6a807a4ced82
'}]
commit_message:
ensure all enums in loadbalancer models have names

fixes bug 1099565

Postgres requires that enums types have names.  This fix adds the name
parameter to the Enum declaration.

Change-Id: Ica67c6cf0b8959761f3022552c1c6a807a4ced82

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-12-23 20:33:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Above failure is not related to this change, but rather it looks like the most recent commit[1] to keystoneclient introduced a dependency into keystoneclient's tools/pip-requires on the 'requests' module, but keystone doesn't appear to install keystoneclient's dependencies.

So, either 'requests' needs to be added to the test-requires for each consuming project/branch (and so on for all new dependencies introduced in future versions of keystoneclient), or keystone needs to start installing keystoneclient's dependencies as part of pulling the project from git for testing.

Optimize if/else logic in quantum.api.v2.base.prepare_request_body()

Removed redundant checkups of variables

Fixes bug #1096932

commit_message:
add database string field length check

Added database string field length check, so when insert to a table, if the length of string field exceed the limit of column when, it will return a 400 error instead of truncating the string.

Change-Id: I7216fe736ea6e5a23b5647b107fcb2699f1fa99d
Fixes: bug #1090247

commit_message:
Cells: Reduce the create_image call depth for cells

This patch reduces the create image call depth (for snapshot/backup) by
returning the basic image details to the user before we call down to
the child cell.  The image entry is created in glance immediately, and
the child cell will finish up the rest.

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

Change-Id: I048cc532614c602f3aa6b539fb51e951174e4598

subject: Allow specification of optional domain name space
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-02 09:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18805/1/check/gate-noop/116 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-02 13:21:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-02 13:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18805/2/check/gate-noop/117 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-02 22:09:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (12 inline comments)

I'm not super excited about simultaneously supporting all these use cases forever (I'd rather just switch from requiring a global namespace to requiring a domain-scoped namespace for users & projects one day). How do end users know if they need to specify a domain on auth -- presumably some will have to and some won't, within the same deployment.

Within the scope of this change, I'd also rather see global_namespace=true/false or private_namespace=true/false rather than supporting an intermediate value (project-private)."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-02 23:29:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dolph - I agree with your desire for a simpler, single state for whether the domain has private or globally unique attributes - and in fact that's how I originally specified this.  The idea for the 3-state approach was to accommodate feedback to try and minimize the cases when the additional domain specification was required for auth, if the enterprise just wanted project privacy.

However, I'm actually quite keen on the simpler approach - and so if we, as a group, think that this is OK, then I'll happily switch this proposal back to the original concept."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-07 18:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If we're going to go with multiple states, I feel like they should at least be independently toggleable. For example, we could theoretically add roles into the namespace options mix, which would result in even more convoluted options (e.g. "A and B to be privately namespaced, but not C").'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-08 17:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-08 17:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18805/3/check/gate-noop/154 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-08 17:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dolph - I think this is what you had in mind - separate booleans to cover each state.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-11 19:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(13 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-12 00:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (13 inline comments)

[{'created': '2013-01-02 09:53:25.000000000', 'message': 'Allow specification of optional domain name space

This documents the v3 api changes proposed to represent the optional
support for domain name spaces, allowing uniqueness of user and
project names to be either global or domain wide.  These changes
match the spec that was part of the blueprint.

blueprint domain-name-spaces

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib824c5c9f441a78b5009e1954d97427e869ed2e4

commit_message:
Allow specification of optional domain name space

This documents the v3 api changes proposed to represent the optional
support for domain name spaces, allowing uniqueness of user and
project names to be either global or domain wide.  These changes
match the spec that was part of the blueprint.

blueprint domain-name-spaces

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib824c5c9f441a78b5009e1954d97427e869ed2e4

commit_message:
Clean up compute API image_create

The _image_create() code in compute manager is the only place where
db.instance_test_and_set is used.. which was added before
'expected_task_state' support was added to instance_update.  By
switching to use self.update(), we can also take advantage of it doing
the state change notification for us.

The instance update and the compute RPC call have been moved out of
_create_image() and into snapshot() and backup() to support a future
cells patch.

Change-Id: Ib6603f732d28e49cb6f351447da5f6e41615dea5

commit_message:
install test dependency on Requests library

The Keystone client has recently changed the requests library for HTTP
http://docs.python-requests.org/en/latest/

In order for the client tests to run, the requests library must be
installed. Without this change, Jenkins will fail on the Client unit
test run.

This makes no change to the live package dependencies.

Change-Id: I57c4e62ceebf25928c0a776c680592e4ba32aa63

commit_message:
boto: instance teardown wait until instance is gone

Instance teardown will wait until the instance not listed or
the absence reported as an error.

Bug: #1098112

Change-Id: Ib863995fcac50e6849ce6633b5aad828675e0504

start the Hyper-V agent

commit_message:
Adds support for deploying Quantum on Windows

Some changes in setup.py are required to properly handle dependencies
and data files on WIndows (including Hyper-V server).

A console script called "quantum-hyperv-agent" has also been added to
start the Hyper-V agent

Change-Id: Ifac2d33afabac242d9dab87b0bc1764421efc16f

commit_message:
Autoload schema before creating FK's (bug 1098174)

The 'service' schema must be loaded before sqlalchemy-migrate can create
ForeignKeys referencing it.

Change-Id: Icd87d40f4c01e4daec0fdb7a6ad93847958236ec

commit_message:
Warning message is not logged for valid token-less request.

if delay_auth_decision is set,auth_token middleware
does not log messages for valid token-less requests.

Fixes: bug #1028683
Change-Id: Ia2069686b86cc833327b11343ebaed59663fd379

commit_message:
Revert "Populate service list with availability zone"

This reverts commit 20ba7028fc406509c5f8430f79f7153f359d87af. This
commit broke unittests which was not caught due to a bug in the way
testr was run through setup.py. Revert the commit to fix the unittests
so that a fix to the way testr is run can merge.

Change-Id: Ie4644a3177d9628607c0d632190c4e48942070d7

commit_message:
More changes to facilitate oslo.

* Cleaning up the CONF defaults in paste created classes
* Updated mgmt-taskmanager
* Small updates to files for oslo
* Removed executils, local
* Fixing constants (removing them from inside method defs)

implements blueprint reddwarf/upgrade-oslo

Change-Id: Ib1a9fe4a829ce2541323693650db412209298a9f

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-01-12 19:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm playing around with this on my SAIO and noticed this.  Should the object-server's REPLICATE's mkdirs() call get similar treatment?

 Jan 11 18:39:08 saio object-server ERROR __call__ error with REPLICATE  /sdb3/116500 : #012Traceback (most recent call last):#012  File  "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/obj/server.py", line 893, in __call__#012    res = method(req)#012  File  "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 1489, in wrapped#012     return func(*a, **kw)#012  File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 477, in _timing_stats#012    resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)#012  File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/obj/server.py", line 871, in REPLICATE#012    mkdirs(path)#012  File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 272, in mkdirs#012    os.makedirs(path)#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs#012    makedirs(head, mode)#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/os.py", line 157, in makedirs#012    mkdir(name, mode)#012OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/srv/3/node/sdb3/objects'

(Hopefully the above formats okay)'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-01-12 19:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Take 2:

 Jan 11 18:39:08 saio object-server ERROR __call__ error with REPLICATE /sdb3/116500 : 
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/obj/server.py", line 893, in __call__   
   res = method(req)
   File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 1489, in wrapped
  return func(*a, **kw)
   File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 477, in _timing_stats
     resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)
   File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/obj/server.py", line 871, in REPLICATE
  mkdirs(path)
   File "/home/swiftstack/swift/swift/common/ut ils.py", line 272, in mkdirs
     os.makedirs(path)
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
     makedirs(head, mode)
   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/os.py", line 157, in makedirs   
   mkdir(name, mode)
 OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/srv/3/node/sdb3/objects''}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-01-12 19:22:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This patch's fix works fine for me, though, logging the error w/stack-trace and completing its run:

 Jan 11 18:44:44 saio object-replicator ERROR creating /srv/3/node/sdb3/objects: #012Traceback...
 ...
 Jan 11 18:44:44 saio object-replicator Object replication complete. (0.00 minutes)"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-12 22:02:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, the object server's REPLICATE call should get the same treatment. I'll put that in and a test for it when I get the chance. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-12 22:06:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh wait, I guess we can let that one slide. We'd just return an error to the caller anyway, so trapping the error to resend it doesn't seem all that useful.

The main problem with the one I have trapped is that it would abort the whole replicator pass."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-01-14 05:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That sounds reasonable...

Unfortunately, "resetswift" on the SAIO blows away logs and I can't remember exactly what the client ended up seeing... but we should double-check that that the 500 (I think?) returned has "an entity containing an explanation of the error situation, and whether it is a temporary or permanent condition." (RFC 2616 §10.5)

Maybe it's worth trapping the error and "deliberately" returning a 500 w/informational body?  Not sure... but it feels "cleaner" to consistently trap and handle that condition.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-14 15:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Seems good enough to me:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-12 07:36:14.000000000', 'message': "Fixed bug in object replicator

If the object replicator couldn't create a device's object directory
(due to permissions or whatever) it wouldn't do any work at all. This
fixes that.

Change-Id: I6a30439d036b29c9cfdb660428d13668e0dc8632
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed bug in object replicator

If the object replicator couldn't create a device's object directory
(due to permissions or whatever) it wouldn't do any work at all. This
fixes that.

Change-Id: I6a30439d036b29c9cfdb660428d13668e0dc8632

[{'created': '2013-01-11 17:27:33.000000000', 'message': "Update v1/images DELETE so it returns empty body.

Fixes an issue in the v1/images controller where a delete
response would contain a 'null' string instead of an empty
request body.

Fixes LP Bug #1098651.

Change-Id: I1a6610fe92e3a7f1221ca6f3e5f9e2c5e6130fbe
"}]
commit_message:
Update v1/images DELETE so it returns empty body.

Fixes an issue in the v1/images controller where a delete
response would contain a 'null' string instead of an empty
request body.

Fixes LP Bug #1098651.

Change-Id: I1a6610fe92e3a7f1221ca6f3e5f9e2c5e6130fbe

commit_message:
Adds support for Quantum networking in Hyper-V

Blueprint quantum-plugin-hyper-v

Adds a VIF plugin model to decouple the Nova Hyper-V compute driver
from the actual networking service in use.
Adds a VIF plugin for Quantum and a plugin for Nova networking.

The VIF driver is selected by mapping the value of the "network_api_class"
option to the corresponding VIF driver class name, avoiding this way an
otherwise redundant configuration option.

Change-Id: If35e814e3e5e181e79249c2f9ea86e878771e4c9

commit_message:
Centralize instance directory logic.

This is the first step to being able to change the name of the instance
directories to something more unique than instance name.

Sneaks up on bug 1023865.

Change-Id: I1340a6b8644680325cba1e90a208e4be33ace6b4

Addendum: since the metaplugin is still defined as experimental in the documentation, the way in which we handle L3 for VLAN networking is to use the Linux L3 and DHCP agents plus the OVS L2 agent for handling the VLAN ports on the networking node, with the HyperV plugin in quantum-server. This is possible due to RPC message compatibility in the OVS and Hyper-V agents for the VLAN network_type (not for GRE of course as the implementation differs and a separate L3 Windows agent will be needed).'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-01-14 22:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-14 22:47:27.000000000', 'message': 'Adds a Hyper-V Quantum plugin

Blueprint quantum-plugin-hyper-v

Initial Hyper-V Quantum plugin including VLAN support.
Support for NVGRE networking will be added in a subsequent patch.
The plugin architecture relies heavily on the OVS plugin, with some
design differences to handle different network types via polymorphism.

The plugin contains two main components:

The plugin itself, to be executed on Linux or Windows
The L2 agent, to be executed on each Hyper-V node

L3 networking is currently handled on Linux with the existing agents.

A Nova Quantum Vif plugin is included in the Nova project.

Change-Id: Ie64bff448e3fb1129c5e24baaf148cdcc0aed8b9

commit_message:
Adds a Hyper-V Quantum plugin

Blueprint quantum-plugin-hyper-v

Initial Hyper-V Quantum plugin including VLAN support.
Support for NVGRE networking will be added in a subsequent patch.
The plugin architecture relies heavily on the OVS plugin, with some
design differences to handle different network types via polymorphism.

The plugin contains two main components:

The plugin itself, to be executed on Linux or Windows
The L2 agent, to be executed on each Hyper-V node

L3 networking is currently handled on Linux with the existing agents.

A Nova Quantum Vif plugin is included in the Nova project.

Change-Id: Ie64bff448e3fb1129c5e24baaf148cdcc0aed8b9

commit_message:
Fix logic error in periodic task wait code.

I was calculating the time to wait for the next run of a periodic
task incorrectly.

Resolves bug 1098819.

Change-Id: Ida60b69014aa06229111e58024e35268262f18fb

commit_message:
Name the securitygrouprules.direction enum.

Updates to the SecurityGroupRule model and migration so that we
explicitly name the securitygrouprules.direction enum. This fixes
'Postgresql ENUM type requires a name.' errors.

Fixes LP Bug #1099267.

Change-Id: Ia46fe8d4b0793caaabbfc71b7fa5f0cbb8c6d24b

'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-14 06:30:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

Keystone already support SSL today. Can you please explain

1) why this is necessary? Is there a bug/blueprint for this?
2) why we can't use the existing keys and certs?"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-14 11:34:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

1) This patch enables SSL on listening socket of the keystone process to enable others to access keystone services over https://. Existing SSL support is *ONLY* for signing tokens and not for ssl endpoints as far as i can tell.

2) No, i don't have a blue print. I have submitted review requests to most of the processes (https://review.openstack.org/#/dashboard/5638). Please note that i am modifying the same wsgi.py across all the projects and trying to keep the same set of options if possible.

3) If you would like, i can change the code to use the existing keys. However since those are for signing tokens, i think folks may need another set of files for the ssl endpoint. It's your call :)

* ``token_format`` - Determines the algorithm used to generate tokens.  Can be either ``UUID`` or ``PKI``. Defaults to ``PKI``
* ``certfile`` - Location of certificate used to verify tokens.  Default is ``/etc/keystone/ssl/certs/signing_cert.pem``
* ``keyfile`` - Location of private key used to sign tokens.  Default is ``/etc/keystone/ssl/private/signing_key.pem``
* ``ca_certs`` - Location of certificate for the authority that issued the above certificate. Default is ``/etc/keystone/ssl/certs/ca.pem``"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-14 17:38:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

1) Correct - you can only deploy keystone w/ SSL using HTTPD, etc, today.

3) I'd prefer discrete variables. Users can set them to the same certs if they prefer. I also don't *think* it's too late to change the cert-related conf variable names if we need to further clarify their intended purposes (they were included in Folsom but not documented, AFAIK)."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-14 20:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-14 21:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

See

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/doc/source/configuration.rst

"
SSL
Keystone may be configured to support 2-way SSL out-of-the-box. The x509 certificates used by Keystone must be obtained externally and configured for use with Keystone as described in this section. However, a set of sample certficates is provided in the examples/pki/certs and examples/pki/private directories with the Keystone distribution for testing. Here is the description of each of them and their purpose:"

Also,

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/bin/keystone-all#L36
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/tests/test_ssl.py

Isn't this already give us SSL endpoint?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-14 21:43:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19562/5/check/gate-keystone-docs/1455 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19562/5/check/gate-keystone-pep8/2971 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/19562/5/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/3437 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-14 21:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

My knowledge on this topic is definitely outdated... I think guang-yee might be correct here.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-14 22:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Somehow i missed this :) thanks guys.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-14 22:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

please see last message from guang-yee'}]

commit_message:
Support for SSL in wsgi.Server

SSL are entirely optional. Support for SSL as well using code from glance. We
have some new options for configuring the SSL support. There are tests for
accessing a sample app w/o ipv6 or ssl, one with just ssl and one with
ipv6 and ssl

DocImpact

Change-Id: I693f3a32a4add88e0e70dee4405339d14966177f

commit_message:
Don't ignore exceptions.

- Raise an exception when there is a configuration error.
- Let exceptions raise themself.

Fixes: bug #1037354
Change-Id: I7e064bf95d6dbce7a52a010411672c237e77afae

Use testr setuptools commands.

upstream. Cleans up a few warnings that this cause tox to show.

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-01-12 19:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Is testr extensible to work like this: https://nose.readthedocs.org/en/latest/doc_tests/test_multiprocess/multiprocess.html ?

- Have option for handle the class as a "single test" (May follow abc order).
- Have option for run the setUpClass once, but run tests in parallel, call the tearDownClass once after all test case are done.

IMHO this merge is OK, lets see what is the opinion of the others.
In other cases I might not be OK with similar changes. 

In some numbered files, the early steps should be re-factored as a big setUpClass and several test cases can be merged to several bigger. (network)

Note: We probably almost never wants to run setUpClass multiple times. When we do not mind multiple setup we can use "setUp" instead of "setUpClass".

Usually the setUpClass allocates the servers and volumes. These things are expensive, regardless of parallel run or not.

In some cases the test does something with the shared resource which prevents other cases to work correctly.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-01-13 20:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This is fine with me. I'm all for consolidating order-dependent test methods into a single test method.

That said, that was pretty much how I had it at first, but people really wanted all the "steps" to be separate test methods so that there was more number of tests in the runner output :(

Just FYI... these are the kinds of things people bring up and we need to be aware of them...'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-01-14 01:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

hi,afazekas. I'm sorry, I havn't found the support in testr like _multiprocess_can_split_ and _multiprocess_shared_ in nosetest. And it is really a problem some setUpClass is so big, if we can and it need be refactored, we will do it."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-01-14 13:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-14 13:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Convert these tests of ServerBasicOps into one test.

These tests must run in the fixed order. When tempest run in one
process, it's ok, because these tests run in alphabetical order.
But when tempest run in multiple process, these tests will run in
random order, some tests will fail. So I think we should make them
one test, not a set of tests. And when it fail, it can give different
information in different stage. I think it's ok.

Part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: I993c11050407786823c99dd93fc514d5627eb433

When running against an old libvirt which lacks support for the
'host-model' CPU type, we must fake it by copying the host CPU

Change-Id: I39c6df6e85d77763ad279961fd6f0da70ac2415e
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

When running against an libvirt < 0.9.10 which lacks support for the
'host-model' CPU type, we must fake it by copying the host CPU

commit_message:
Fix addition of CPU features when running against legacy libvirt

When running against an libvirt < 0.9.10 which lacks support for the
'host-model' CPU type, we must fake it by copying the host CPU
model and features. Unfortunately the code was forgetting to
append the new features to the CPU object feature list

Bug: 1099527
Change-Id: I39c6df6e85d77763ad279961fd6f0da70ac2415e
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

exception is an empty dictionary.

removed erroneous group 'donut' from tests

added default group GROUP and requested TODO

fixed tests to use poll_until instead of while loops as the loops
had race conditions where they would never close.

changed sleep to a poll_until method and caused the test to fail
if the initial migration times out because then the failure
scenario is no longer reproducable.

removed erroneous spaces that found their way into the models
code

removed unused import sys

simplify some of the code paths to make the test more concise

commit_message:
Fix uses of service_get_all_compute_by_host

There should never be more than 1 service entry for the same topic and
host, however this method returns a list of services.  All callers of
this method except for 1 already account for there being only 1 service
entry for a particular 'compute' host and only use the first entry in the
return list.

This patch renames the DB API call to be 'service_get_by_compute_host'
and returns a single entry.  All uses of the old method are adjusted
accordingly.

Change-Id: I0e0ef62f5d2e71efe756940d9fdd98aa02fef216

[{'created': '2013-01-14 07:36:01.000000000', 'message': 'Some optimizations for ring rebalancing.

For a part-power 18 ring with a small number of devices (12), this drops
"swift-ring-builder ... rebalance" from ~7.2 seconds to ~3.6s on OS X
with Python 2.7 (2.7 GHz i7 processor).

Under the profiler, that part-power 18 rebalance now spends only
slightly more time rebalancing the ring than it does writing out the
results.

I haven't done more extensive before/after comparison with larger
numbers of devices and larger part-power values...

Change-Id: I25735bc71da2f11617cc436d4f8e0c4f3f82bfec
'}]
commit_message:
Some optimizations for ring rebalancing.

For a part-power 18 ring with a small number of devices (12), this drops
"swift-ring-builder ... rebalance" from ~7.2 seconds to ~3.6s on OS X
with Python 2.7 (2.7 GHz i7 processor).

Under the profiler, that part-power 18 rebalance now spends only
slightly more time rebalancing the ring than it does writing out the
results.

I haven't done more extensive before/after comparison with larger
numbers of devices and larger part-power values...

Change-Id: I25735bc71da2f11617cc436d4f8e0c4f3f82bfec

commit_message:
VMware Compute Driver Rename

blueprint vmware-compute-driver

Rename VMWare to VMware
Rename network_utils to network_util to conform to the util class naming convention
Remove the infinite loop in vim.__getattr__

Change-Id: I5bdad331a86c7aa4ca36e7a8345b53e455678c0f

commit_message:
Keep self and context out of error notification payload.

Back in the day, having self and context in the error notifications
was handy for debugging. Now, there is a lot of confidential stuff
stored in these objects (especially when self = ComputeManager) ...
like passwords, etc.

This patch strips it out.

Also removes dead wrap_exception calls (which did nothing since they
did not specify a notifier).

Change-Id: Ieab7bd79b64e01c7bca18dbce97455e50094871c

commit_message:
reorder tables for delete

Reordered the tables in the domain downgrade script to avoid breaking i
the integrity constraints.   This only shows up when run against a
live database, as sqlite does not enforce them.

Change-Id: I00b687fb78d00c6240c8afb0efc26a9730ce4436

commit_message:
Extract validation and provision code to separate method

This enables the blueprint vm-ensembles to make use of the existing
Nova logic for the VM validations prior to scheduling.

Change-Id: I4966742b5f06087ad74ac75cbdf946f0bd9b6431

commit_message:
Update functionality of coverage extension.

Change If1aa25fc7237e9bb5100d2a4a8e560f0a68eba61 adds additional
functionality to the coverage extension. Mainly returning the
data file path for the 'stop' action and adding support for
generating html reports. This commit adds support for this new
functionality.

Change-Id: Icd147350d5c038f6b9c8063e77a75370eb8422e9

[{'created': '2013-01-09 09:07:26.000000000', 'message': 'Factor out LVM code.

Currently volume drivers inherit from VolumeDriver and ISCSIDriver,
which contain LVM-specific code. The LVM-specific functions are
generally overridden. The problem is that there is no place for
generic code for all drivers to inherit, which the LVM driver can
override. This patch basically makes the VolumeDriver and ISCSIDriver
classes mostly empty and moves the LVM-specific code to lvm.py. Also,
moved the global _iscsi_location() and _iscsi_authentication()
functions into the new LVMISCSIDriver class since nobody else used
them.

Change-Id: I067c975de97913bdc39086ad203cddef0c393c7a

commit_message:
Factor out LVM code.

Currently volume drivers inherit from VolumeDriver and ISCSIDriver,
which contain LVM-specific code. The LVM-specific functions are
generally overridden. The problem is that there is no place for
generic code for all drivers to inherit, which the LVM driver can
override. This patch basically makes the VolumeDriver and ISCSIDriver
classes mostly empty and moves the LVM-specific code to lvm.py. Also,
moved the global _iscsi_location() and _iscsi_authentication()
functions into the new LVMISCSIDriver class since nobody else used
them.

Change-Id: I067c975de97913bdc39086ad203cddef0c393c7a
Implements: blueprint factor-out-lvm-code

commit_message:
Fix import failures on coverage runs.

The tempest_coverage.py script can't import from tempest because it
is located in the tools directory. This change runs python with '-m'
to add the tempest directory to PYTHONPATH.

Change-Id: I709474b97f2bf6d161bc063751874ca8054aa2ed

commit_message:
Populate service list with availability zone

Fixes bug 1099399

Availability zone was removed from the service object and is now added
via a separate call to availabilty_zones.set_availability_zones

Change-Id: I89126bb72e482f3ce701a9e28035416805a639a0

[{'created': '2013-01-14 17:26:38.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Add metadata validation to WaitConditionHandle

Validate metadata before updating the WaitConditionHandle resource
metadata, if we raise a ValueError in response to incorrectly
formatted metadata then the CFN API will map this to a
HeatInvalidParameterValueError, resulting in a descriptive error
response to the malformed request

Change-Id: I6fde27066e9e0eaee97b59a7fbbace09ca620b48
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-01-14 18:14:24.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Add metadata validation to WaitConditionHandle

Validate metadata before updating the WaitConditionHandle resource
metadata, if we raise a ValueError in response to incorrectly

commit_message:
heat engine : Add metadata validation to WaitConditionHandle

Validate metadata before updating the WaitConditionHandle resource
metadata, if we raise a ValueError in response to incorrectly
formatted metadata then the CFN API will map this to a
HeatInvalidParameterValueError, resulting in a descriptive error
response to the malformed request

Change-Id: I6fde27066e9e0eaee97b59a7fbbace09ca620b48
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make object-auditor to use one logger

This commit makes that AuditorWorker gets a logger from ObjectAuditor class
(instead of creating new one) so the auditor uses minimum unix-sockets.

Fixes: bug #1089215
Change-Id: Ia47d862cbe7505db821784b01fcce6f22196e79f

[{'created': '2013-01-14 17:26:37.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : implement metadata_update per-resource

Abstract updates to resource metadata so they are implemented per-resource,
with a generic implementation which is a no-op, since currently the only
resource which needs metadata update via the RPC API is WaitConditionHandle.
This allows resource-specific metadata validation and update logic to be more
easily added.

ref bug 1097813

Change-Id: I094e74b6cd8cb2436f05beed9629fc3c3a34e622
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : implement metadata_update per-resource

Abstract updates to resource metadata so they are implemented per-resource,
with a generic implementation which is a no-op, since currently the only
resource which needs metadata update via the RPC API is WaitConditionHandle.
This allows resource-specific metadata validation and update logic to be more
easily added.

ref bug 1097813

Change-Id: I094e74b6cd8cb2436f05beed9629fc3c3a34e622
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-09 18:43:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue in test_forbidden_action_exposure.

Updates the test_forbidden_action_exposure in test_exception.py
so that it no longer tries to raise an incorrectly formed
ForbiddenAction exception when CONF.debug = False. ForbiddenAction
exception *should* have all kwargs specified even if a message is set
because in non-debug mode only exception formatting gets used.

Previously this test would pass because exception.py handled all
exception format errors. While handling exception formatting errors is
Okay at runtime ideally we want to check for them when running tests.

Change-Id: I47d16405254c14655c64e4587530c29ba15ab80c
'}, {'created': '2013-01-09 19:46:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix issue in test_forbidden_action_exposure.

Updates the test_forbidden_action_exposure in test_exception.py
so that it no longer tries to raise an incorrectly formed
ForbiddenAction exception when CONF.debug = False.

ForbiddenAction exception *should* have all kwargs specified even if
a message is set because in non-debug mode only exception formatting gets used.

Previously this test would pass because exception.py handled all
exception format errors. While handling exception formatting errors is
Okay at runtime ideally we want to check for them when running tests.

This commit also enhances the test_forbidden_action_exposure so that it
checks for the existence of the 'action' in the exception message...
where the 'message' should be absent.

Change-Id: I47d16405254c14655c64e4587530c29ba15ab80c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue in test_forbidden_action_exposure.

Updates the test_forbidden_action_exposure in test_exception.py
so that it no longer tries to raise an incorrectly formed
ForbiddenAction exception when CONF.debug = False.

ForbiddenAction exception *should* have all kwargs specified even if
a message is set because in non-debug mode only exception formatting gets used.

Previously this test would pass because exception.py handled all
exception format errors. While handling exception formatting errors is
Okay at runtime ideally we want to check for them when running tests.

This commit also enhances the test_forbidden_action_exposure so that it
checks for the existence of the 'action' in the exception message...
where the 'message' should be absent.

Change-Id: I47d16405254c14655c64e4587530c29ba15ab80c

[{'created': '2013-01-09 18:43:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add _FATAL_EXCEPTION_FORMAT_ERRORS global.

Add a new global variable to control when exception format errors
are fatal. The goal is to be able to use this at test time to detect
incorrectly formatted exceptions.

Change-Id: Ia015bc27a445757cb1d574cadc35698cca0de086
'}]
commit_message:
Add _FATAL_EXCEPTION_FORMAT_ERRORS global.

Add a new global variable to control when exception format errors
are fatal. The goal is to be able to use this at test time to detect
incorrectly formatted exceptions.

Change-Id: Ia015bc27a445757cb1d574cadc35698cca0de086

commit_message:
Remove accessing cfg.CONF.DATABASE in nec-agent

Fixes bug 1099162

The database configuration was moved to the common DB module.
There no longer needs to access database configuration in the
plugin specific code.

Change-Id: I4b80ea1e84ffa06d0fffa7f8ccdee08a5b77e239
