'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-01-06 16:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-01-07 02:13:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

testr run --parallel should not be running the same test case class in multiple processes. The reason is because the setUpClass methods of pretty much all the test case classes are the most resource-intensive and slow-running parts of the test. If you parallelize and run that setup X number of times, you are going to slow down the test run, not speed it up :)

Basically, I'm saying that we shouldn't be changing our base test case class to overcome any shortcoming in testr. We need to have our code indicate to testr that it should not run a test case class' setUpClass() more than once."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-01-07 14:15:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Basically, I agree with Jay. But even if we run test case using Nose in one process, the setUpClass and tearDownClass methods will also run once for every test in the Class.
So when we run it in multiple processes, we won't increase the testing time. Anyway that's not the point. If we can have our code tell testr which work can be divided, which should be treated as atomic, it will be better. But currently I have no idea how we can do this."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-01-08 14:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

setUpClass will only run once. setUp will be run for each test.
Likewise for tearDown.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-01-09 02:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, setUpClass will only run once. setUp will be run for each test. Likewise for tearDown. Sorry I am wrong.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-01-10 19:00:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

FWIW I think this should be landed. Test correctness is test correctness. Future iterations can preserve the correctness while adding smarter scheduling, but this lets parallel work now.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-01-10 20:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

Well, if "work" means speeding things up then I don't think it will. But if this will help progress, so be it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-10 20:40:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-05 10:16:22.000000000', 'message': 'ensure isolated test cases run with an isolated tenant

If some test cases run with the same tenant and in muiltprocess(using
'testr run --parallel'), race problem will raise. Because one test
case maybe delete the tenant in tearDownClass, but at the sametime
another test case run in another process have passed the setUpClass
stage, the AuthenticationFailure will arises. like this:
"AuthenticationFailure: Authentication with user
FlavorsTestJSON-user and password pass failed"

Part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Ie840e02778165182461b2b0802db523b354a9b05
'}]
commit_message:
ensure isolated test cases run with an isolated tenant

If some test cases run with the same tenant and in muiltprocess(using
'testr run --parallel'), race problem will raise. Because one test
case maybe delete the tenant in tearDownClass, but at the sametime
another test case run in another process have passed the setUpClass
stage, the AuthenticationFailure will arises. like this:
"AuthenticationFailure: Authentication with user
FlavorsTestJSON-user and password pass failed"

Part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: Ie840e02778165182461b2b0802db523b354a9b05

commit_message:
Add support for a "sudo" like mechanism in the API.

Adding an X-Moniker-Tenant-ID request header to API calls will allow admins to `sudo` to another tenant.

Fixes bug #1083597

Change-Id: I95f07cc7f017b0ecf9989bf0c4bae8962c039523

commit_message:
Add list-extensions to list of nova cli commands

This list-extensions command was added in Folsom.

from bug 1094955

There are other new flags of existing commands mentioned to add from
Folsom, but these require creating new examples, which may come later

A separate review will come for the grizzly features, so this one can
be cherrypicked for backport

Change-Id: Id41b9a4acfd7298d42a2030b8224f4d3b9b39ba6

How would you feel about creating one or more of these as part of the nova install?  I actually use the m1.micro that's created in the sample local.sh  but could live with a 64Mb rather than 128Mb.  All of the exercises passed with a 64Mb DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE flavor.

Otherwise I'll +2 this after you get the hard tabs out."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-01-12 22:06:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hard TABs needs removed as Dean says, but I'm definitely in favor of this one!"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-01-13 00:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-01-13 00:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I can't move it to nova because it needs to run after the service started.

The first 6 flavor set by SQLAlchemy-Migrate (db sync).

Possible to create a poststart_nova function and call it from the stack.sh.

If I want to avoid the cross variable references,  the tempest logic would by picking 2 flavor with the lowest memory need.

I saw the m1.micro, Thats why I selected to smaller SI prefixes.

m1.micro can be the 64MB and the m1.nano the 32MB

The boto still set to "m1.tiny", it will be changed later.
I can change the logic at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-13 00:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-01-11 02:34:18.000000000', 'message': "Make it clearer that nova.network.api.API is nova-network specific.

This may save confusion for new folk, as the indirection to rpcapi
isn't intended to be used to plug quantum in - instead the whole API
object is replaced.

Change-Id: Ib3680826b2ab1e18d249f447828fd1ac9e81132f
"}, {'created': '2013-01-11 06:28:59.000000000', 'message': "Make it clearer that nova.network.api.API is nova-network specific.

Change-Id: Ib3680826b2ab1e18d249f447828fd1ac9e81132f
"}, {'created': '2013-01-11 06:30:01.000000000', 'message': "Make it clearer that network.api.API is nova-network specific.

isn't intended to be used to plug quantum in - instead the whole API
object is replaced.

Change-Id: Ib3680826b2ab1e18d249f447828fd1ac9e81132f

commit_message:
Make it clearer that network.api.API is nova-network specific.

This may save confusion for new folk, as the indirection to rpcapi
isn't intended to be used to plug quantum in - instead the whole API
object is replaced.

Change-Id: Ib3680826b2ab1e18d249f447828fd1ac9e81132f

[{'created': '2013-01-13 13:26:54.000000000', 'message': 'Support RHEL with lsb_release

Consider all distributor as "Red Hat" which id matches to the Red.*Hat regexp.

Example Distributor ID: "RedHatEnterpriseServer"

Change-Id: I29cc2e83cccaafa3e1e056e506fda5c9771764a1
'}]
commit_message:
Support RHEL with lsb_release

Consider all distributor as "Red Hat" which id matches to the Red.*Hat regexp.

Example Distributor ID: "RedHatEnterpriseServer"

Change-Id: I29cc2e83cccaafa3e1e056e506fda5c9771764a1

commit_message:
Adds a screen running dstat

As a way to easily watch the health of the system while it's running, just
run dstat in a screen session.

Change-Id: Ieb3bbdcf54898ba54f8703780e99fcc9167cf592

commit_message:
Make nova network manager fill in vif_type

Make the Nova network manager impl fill in the 'vif_type' parameter
in the VIF configuration for instances. This is hardcoded to
VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE, since that's all Nova network supports.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I46d1f0edc820ccc198e5a5c876ea25644ebedd86
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add some constants to the network model for drivers to use

Following on from

  commit 85f857e62a5edacbf467c19add6e51565ae3669f
  Author: Gary Kotton <gkotton@redhat.com>
  Date:   Sat Dec 8 08:54:16 2012 +0000

    Add vif_type to the VIF model

add some constants to nova.network.model to enumerate the valid
values for 'vif_type'. Also add a constant for max bridge name
length

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I47949c06fee732681bf0b547577f22a319d4e408
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move libvirt VIF XML config into designer.py

There are a fixed set of sensible XML configurations for
network VIFs. Create some helper methods for configuring
these configurations. Then update the VIF drivers to call
these APIs. The 'designer.py' file will serve as a place
for any policy based XML configuration helpers, as distinct
from config.py which is purely dealing with XML parsing
and formatting

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I857607c15ed576c65f898df4eb7533505742324b
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-10 12:32:41.000000000', 'message': "Add auth middleware for custom cloud backend

Custom backends will want to provide their own authentication mechanisms
instead of using the Keystone token or EC2-like systems we have in
place.

This adds a new middleware and paste pipeline for the custom backend
that will skip the normal authentication and queries the backend's
`authenticated(context)` method instead.

Since the backend is connected to the Engine whereas the auth middleware
is run in the API service (which may sit on a separate box and have no
access to the engine config or the custom backend itself), we add a new
RPC call that lets API verify the passed credentials.

Change-Id: I2fc4a19564b1e410adb79bd9266f6b6da07dd6c9
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-11 18:21:41.000000000', 'message': "Add auth middleware for custom cloud backend

commit_message:
Add auth middleware for custom cloud backend

Custom backends will want to provide their own authentication mechanisms
instead of using the Keystone token or EC2-like systems we have in
place.

This adds a new middleware and paste pipeline for the custom backend
that will skip the normal authentication and queries the backend's
`authenticated(context)` method instead.

Since the backend is connected to the Engine whereas the auth middleware
is run in the API service (which may sit on a separate box and have no
access to the engine config or the custom backend itself), we add a new
RPC call that lets API verify the passed credentials.

Change-Id: I2fc4a19564b1e410adb79bd9266f6b6da07dd6c9
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Add configurable cloud backend

This allows us to use a different IaaS backend (other than OpenStack).
OpenStack is still used by default.

Change-Id: I1772d57ae583a281204edfb80fbfde220b004a9d
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-01-10 13:21:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you for the patch! It looks good to me and works very nicely.

I think it'd be nicer to include a test though, so we can make sure we don't lose the ability to set unlimited quotas again. It looks simple enough to modify an existing test to do so: 

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/projects/tests.py#L470

After poking at it a bit though... it appears the updating quotas part of this test may not actually be working. A simple change to those 2 lines to something like this:

        quota[0].limit = 444
        quota[1].limit = -1

would make sure we both test for unlimited quotas specifically and for updated quotas in general.

Thank you!"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:47:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Allow setting nova quotas to unlimited

To set a quota to unlimited it is set to -1

Fix bug 1082489

commit_message:
Display subnet cidr information in net-list

Fixes bug 1074415

This commit introduces extend_list() in ListCommand class. This method
can be used to update a retrieved list (e.g., add additional information
or convert some field to more human-readable value).

Change-Id: Icf5ab616ab4d9add16c921e1944ba37b376b2ab2

Remove unsused imports in the plugins package

Config imports are needed for correct init
quota_db is required to make sure quota database model at the proper timing

commit_message:
Allow known options defined after position arguments.

We run the argument parser to split known options and unknown options.
Make '-' work and have the same effect as '_' in both known and unknown
option parts.
Make metavar Uppercase.

blueprint options-location

Change-Id: Ic27b278484133c8b83e3b031a0810a76b050219f

commit_message:
Run stop_servers and cleanup in addCleanup.

All of the tests have stop_servers and cleanup calls in them - but we can
do all of that consistently at the root level of the testing tree.

Additionally, we can make the Server classes into fixtures.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0040eeb3a927aec04de59c1dc2bf7aa356e6a6e4

commit_message:
Switch testrunner from nova to testr.

Enable parallel test running via testr. Simple testing shows this to be
5x faster on my laptop - even better if you've got something with some cores.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I908d4016fe12ce32d7e28b7bf07d8d178d42141e

commit_message:
adding hypervisors panel to admin dashboard

This commit adds a new panel "Hypervisors" to the system panel in
the admin dashboard listing all registered hypervisors hosts by
using the os-hypervisors extension of the Nova API.

Change-Id: Iabb26b864eaddd186fca4081c802f16a42524232

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-13 20:26:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ref to customizing api-paste.ini

Customizing api-paste.ini with keystone auth info is no longer
required. This was mostly fixed in a previous doc patch[1], but there
was a residual statement about changing api-paste.ini that's no longer
relevant.

This patch removes that statement. We no longer show the example
api-paste.ini file in the "Configuring OpenStack Compute" section,
since no changes to the file are needed.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/15310

Change-Id: I7e7a245d6ea0e7371c0fe6c79898bd5d7fbaf89e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ref to customizing api-paste.ini

Customizing api-paste.ini with keystone auth info is no longer
required. This was mostly fixed in a previous doc patch[1], but there
was a residual statement about changing api-paste.ini that's no longer
relevant.

This patch removes that statement. We no longer show the example
api-paste.ini file in the "Configuring OpenStack Compute" section,
since no changes to the file are needed.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/15310

Change-Id: I7e7a245d6ea0e7371c0fe6c79898bd5d7fbaf89e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 11:31:58.000000000', 'message': "Cells: Add sync_instances to API extension

Adds an option to sync_instances to API cell..

One can POST to cells/sync_instances and pass a body with the following
options:

'project_id'    -- specify a project_id to sync (all projects by default)
'deleted'       -- specify whether to sync deleted instances (False by
                   default)
'updated_since' -- Only sync instances that have been updated since a
                   certain time

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie156fb4803d4bedf7cb2d5578d5949096a0cf773

commit_message:
Cells: Add sync_instances to API extension

Adds an option to sync_instances to API cell..

One can POST to cells/sync_instances and pass a body with the following
options:

'project_id'    -- specify a project_id to sync (all projects by default)
'deleted'       -- specify whether to sync deleted instances (False by
                   default)
'updated_since' -- Only sync instances that have been updated since a
                   certain time

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie156fb4803d4bedf7cb2d5578d5949096a0cf773

commit_message:
Trivial commit to make daily rpm builds work again.

A trivial commit is needed so that the
grizzly-2 tag is not on git HEAD.

Change-Id: Id671f1e2f39d93e6e9caff644fd9764d9de4f38e

commit_message:
Validated URLs in v2 endpoint creation API

Fixed the 500 response when endpoint is created without specifying
either adminurl, publicurl or internalurl empty.
Added unit test coverage for v2 endpoint create API.

Fixes LP: #1097747

Change-Id: I1875859bd7e197e985a5b5395c8caefff3c83b11

subject: Specify target of a domain role grant
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2012-12-29 16:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-29 16:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-29 16:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18706/4/check/gate-noop/111 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-02 23:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I feel like this is muddling the semantics of what we've defined a domain to be ("a collection of projects") and how we're using them... I see the utility of differentiating between permissions on the container versus permissions on the contents of the container, but I'm not sure that overloading the semantics of these calls is the right way to solve that. Do we have an immediate use case for all this?

Using the term "recursive," I would also expect that if I PUT a domain-level grant, I should successfully be able to GET that grant back on all projects it was applied to, and then be able to non-recursively DELETE the domain grant, retaining the project-level grants that were created. It doesn't look like that's the case here?

e.g. Grant a role to a user on all projects with the specified domain ID:

  PUT /users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id}/projects?domain_id={domain_id}

This way it's clear that you're granting to a collection of projects, whereas the existing call would only apply to the specified domain, but not to it's containing projects?'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-02 23:37:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Dolph - so the use case I am trying to enable is when you DO want to just assign a role to the container (e..g. I want to create a domain administrator that can just manage the user and groups of the domain, but doesn't have access to any projects).  The existing spec stated that assigning a role to a domain assigned that role to all projects within it - i.e. there was not way to assign a role to the container.

I actually prefer your approach of changing the semantics of assigning a role to a domain to mean just for the container, and using the domain_id parameter specification on the PUT to projects if you want to assign the role to all the enclosed projects.  If you agree, I'll re-draft this proposal along those lines."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-03 16:53:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yeah, assigning a role to the container itself was not a use case we were solving for, but the existing domain-role-grant call is more appropriate for that than for assigning project-role-grant-for-all-projects-in-a-domain.

I'm going to take a second look at the existing calls, but I think I'd rather redefine them to serve this use case and add a whole new call for the existing use case."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-03 17:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-03 17:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18706/5/check/gate-noop/127 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-03 17:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Dolph - here it is re-drafted along those line'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-03 22:07:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

I've been thinking about this a lot today... by repurposing the existing domain grant to *not* apply to all containing projects, we've already satisfied the other use case, e.g. client pseudocode to grant a user a role on all projects in a domain:

  GET /projects?domain_id={domain_id}
  returns [collection of projects]

  for each project in [collection of projects]:
    PUT /projects/{project_id}/users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id}

So, do we specifically need an API to avoid N + 1 requests here?"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:02:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

To reduce the HTTP chatter of the above alternative, I'd be in support of something like (2 calls instead of N + 1):

  projects = GET /projects?domain_id={domain_id}

  POST /users/{user_id}/roles/{role_id}/projects
    request body=[project.id for project in projects]

... where the create operation is idempotent and the request body is basically just providing a list of project ID's."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-03 23:57:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

So I'm fine with that...it was just given the existing api seemed to include the ability to assign a role to all projects in a domain - I was assuming we had a good use case.  However, I think you can make the argument that many of the automation/orchestration products above openstack will support this type of ability as well.  If it really does become a need, we can always add it in a future release.  I therefore suggest I reduce this change to simply the re-specification of the semantics of assigning a role to a domain (i.e. it means assign it to the container only).

As an aside, regarding your comment on re-ordering the terms of the other api calls, I wonder if we should consider that anyway - I think there might be a case for an order like:

PUT /roles/{role_id}/users/{user_id}/projects/{project_id}

since that logically matches the intent (i.e. Grant Role X to User Y for Project Z).  However, let's discuss that outside of this change."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-06 10:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-06 10:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18706/6/check/gate-noop/145 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-11 21:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-01-13 22:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-13 22:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: No score

Build successful

'}]

When a user or group domain role grant is made, the current api
specification states that this should be treated as applying the
role to all enclosed projects.  This change re-defines the meaning
of a domain grant to be a grant on the container itself, so that
role such as Domain Administrator (e.g. maintain users for a
specific domain) can be implemented.

If in the future there is a strong use case for an "apply a role to
a collection of projects", then we will consider this with something
like:

PUT /roles/{role_id}/users/{user_id}/projects?domain_id={domain_id}

Blueprint domain-role-assignment

DocImpact

Change-Id: If7d90902cc09c749b2e0793063b3d113347569d5

commit_message:
Specify target of a domain role grant

When a user or group domain role grant is made, the current api
specification states that this should be treated as applying the
role to all enclosed projects.  This change re-defines the meaning
of a domain grant to be a grant on the container itself, so that
role such as Domain Administrator (e.g. maintain users for a
specific domain) can be implemented.

If in the future there is a strong use case for an "apply a role to
a collection of projects", then we will consider this with something
like:

PUT /roles/{role_id}/users/{user_id}/projects?domain_id={domain_id}

Blueprint domain-role-assignment

DocImpact

Change-Id: If7d90902cc09c749b2e0793063b3d113347569d5

commit_message:
Fix "sudo: sorry, you must have a tty to run sudo"

On many systems the requiretty sudoers option is turned on by default.
With "requiretty" option the sudo ensures the user have real tty access.

Just several "su" variant has an option for skipping the new session creation step.

Only one session can posses a tty, so after a "su -c" the sudo will not
work.

We will use sudo instead of su, when we create the stack account.

This change adds new variable the STACK_USER for
 service username.

Change-Id: I1b3fbd903686884e74a5a22d82c0c0890e1be03c

commit_message:
Inform a client if Quantum provides port filtering feature

Part of blueprint vif-plugging-improvements

Quantum and Nova have duplicated functionality of packet filtering
such as security groups and anti spoofing filters.
By passing information whether Quantum supports the port filtering feature,
Nova VIF driver can skip its own packet filtering setup.

It is based on Daniel's advise in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19436/

Change-Id: Ifd260cb61aa3990251510a4a3fe15454d8d584df

[{'created': '2013-01-01 17:25:37.000000000', 'message': "Add error handling to delete incomplete data.

If failing to create a new image('glance image-create' command),
incomplete image data remains in glance server.
For example, 'queued' image data remains if not specifying necessary
--disk-format parameter like the following:

  $ glance image-create --file root-fs.img --name test
  Request returned failure status.
  HTTPBadRequest (HTTP 400)
  $
  $ glance image-list
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+
  | ID | Name | Disk Format | Container Format | Size     | Status |
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+
  | .. | test |             |                  | 25165824 | queued |
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+

To solve this problem, this patch adds an error handling for deleting
incomplete image data.

Fixes bug 1095081

Change-Id: Id163eb968bd89626b94738d5143b2f64179f02ee
"}, {'created': '2013-01-05 00:08:08.000000000', 'message': "Add error handling to delete invalid meta data.

If failing to create a new image with invalid parameters, invalid image
meta data remains in glance server.
For example, 'queued' image data remains if not specifying necessary
--disk-format parameter like the following:

  $ glance image-create --file root-fs.img --name test
  Request returned failure status.
  HTTPBadRequest (HTTP 400)
  $
  $ glance image-list
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+
  | ID | Name | Disk Format | Container Format | Size     | Status |
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+
  | .. | test |             |                  | 25165824 | queued |
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+

To solve this problem, this patch adds an error handling for deleting
invalid image meta data.

Fixes bug 1095081

Change-Id: Id163eb968bd89626b94738d5143b2f64179f02ee
"}]
commit_message:
Add error handling to delete invalid meta data.

If failing to create a new image with invalid parameters, invalid image
meta data remains in glance server.
For example, 'queued' image data remains if not specifying necessary
--disk-format parameter like the following:

  $ glance image-create --file root-fs.img --name test
  Request returned failure status.
  HTTPBadRequest (HTTP 400)
  $
  $ glance image-list
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+
  | ID | Name | Disk Format | Container Format | Size     | Status |
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+
  | .. | test |             |                  | 25165824 | queued |
  +----+------+-------------+------------------+----------+--------+

To solve this problem, this patch adds an error handling for deleting
invalid image meta data.

Fixes bug 1095081

Change-Id: Id163eb968bd89626b94738d5143b2f64179f02ee

I'm +2 on the compute/manager fixes for sure. There seems to be a lot of noise in the test file, which makes it hard for me to tell if it's even related to the manager bits. Are those general cleanups or in any way related to the instance_update changes?

Also, are there places in test_compute where we might validate that the private methods you made return the updated instance still do?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-12 03:30:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Those 2 tests that I modified failed after I made these changes as they were testing that they were dealing with the original instance the whole way through.  They needed (or at least the first one in the file did) significant work to test that they were using the updated instance correctly.  In doing so, I moved some things around to make it easier to read.. or so I thought.  The first test was doing all sorts of funky stuff like stubbing rpc.* methods when it should have been just stubbing the rpcapi call, etc.

As far as the other tests that are obviously not making sure they're dealing with the new instance properly... yes they should check... but I'll probably have to modify them significantly (to the point of re-writing them using mox) so that arguments to method calls are verified.  I want to do a general test fixup in test_compute, but not in this patch.

But if you prefer to see the tests fixed to check that they are dealing with the updated instance properly before this merges, I can do so.  I'd split this patch up into multiple patches and it'll take a while longer to get it all done."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-12 14:53:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

There's a number of cases of using stale instance data in the compute
manager.  Ie, there are a lot of calls to self._instance_update() that
ignore the response and use a stale copy of data from that point
forward.

Related to bug 1098727

That bug id is for 'reboot_instance' only, so there's a separate patch
to fix that method.

Change-Id: Ifec6bf23831b51c8679528428ee475c906c1f536
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of stale instance data in compute manager

There's a number of cases of using stale instance data in the compute
manager.  Ie, there are a lot of calls to self._instance_update() that
ignore the response and use a stale copy of data from that point
forward.

Related to bug 1098727

That bug id is for 'reboot_instance' only, so there's a separate patch
to fix that method.

Change-Id: Ifec6bf23831b51c8679528428ee475c906c1f536

Convert ConfigDriveHelper to being a context manager itself.

This is a little bit less awkward than the previous implementation,
and is based on a suggestion from Padraig Brady.

commit_message:
DHCP agent unable to access port when restarting

Fixes bug 1099072

The security groups would return an exception for invalid port ownership.

Change-Id: I8c48adce30b160bd776b5e68bc321e3a2e8cbce2

commit_message:
Fixes quantum.api.v2.base._filters to be more intuitive

Converts values in one place and sets dictonary according to the return value

Fixes bug #1092977

Change-Id: I05dd9b24a8ab20f8c302c22f5bdda2a80ec90e19

commit_message:
Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

bug 1092227

Change-Id: Ib5a005665a5b11198006ce2aa2432399a41fc3d9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Clean up lib/quantum

* Update variable dependencies
* Update the description about services and plugins

* Remove linuxnet_interface_driver setting from create_nova_conf_quantum()
  since it is no longer used.
* Remove adding route to a tenant network (Since quantum-metadata-agent
  has been implemented the route to the tenant network is no longer required.)

* Remove mix use of KEYSTONE_AUTH_* and KEYSTONE_SERVICE_*
  and use KEYSTONE_AUTH_* if KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT is used.
* Mark function local variables declared as local.
* Rename function local variables to lower-case name.

Change-Id: I83c956b54d121cb73bae24b16b64fd430cd6120d

commit_message:
Use default_notification_level when notification

Fix bug 1089773

Notifications in quantum api do not honor default_notification_level
in quantum.conf and always use INFO level. On the other hand
dhcp-agent refers to default_notification_level.
If default_notification_level is set to a value other than INFO,
dhcp-agent cannot receive notification from quantum server.

Change-Id: Ie3ae576d62e91651aa59b2324ec114716181107f

This is great. A few weeks back, I spent half a day with pdb tracing 

  TypeError: exceptions must be old-style classes or derived from BaseException, not NoneType

through sqlalchemy, but eventually gave up and didn't find a solution to the lame error. Just as the stackforge thread shows, my problem was a simple SQL error that got obfuscated.

That being said, I'd rather see the fix in sqlalchemy or eventlet. This patch to NovaBase will add a lot of db round trips, and sub transactions aren't free. Though small, they do have a CPU cost on the database. If we do fix it here, it should be reverted as soon as there's an upstream fix in place. 

I'm giving a +1 cause a fix is better than no fix :)"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-01-11 15:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For quick reference, here's a link to the issue on the eventlet boards, extracted from the stack forge thread:

commit_message:
Fix error in NovaBase.save() method

There is a bug in sqlalchemy with eventlet that doesn't allows us to use
session.flush() without explicit transaction.
If somethings went wrong in DB and rollback is called it will try to
raise NoneType.

I found only one way to handle this situation.
We should start transaction (or subtransaction if it already exists in session)
explicitly.

Fixes bug 1098692

Change-Id: I12cd643500e341a013cd7c963cb5d1a0106c7940

commit_message:
Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's instance

Add 'project_id=None' optional argument in QUOTAS related methods.

There are two problems when admin deletes instances of common user
before fixing this bug:
Firstly, It will get tenant quotas using context.project_id which
results in getting admin's quotas not common user's.
Secondly, It will also get wrong quota usages using context.project_id
when updating common user's quota_usages.

So we could pass into QUOTAS related methods an optional argument to
specify the tenant ID to be affected. And if it's not set, then we
default to drawing the tenant ID from the context.

Fixes: bug 1078668
Change-Id: I59bc240d6547122d803a3ed3e1eeef26fc78f4f0

This makes me nervous.  I'd almost rather it inject the HTML file into the directory if it discovers a directory.  Where does the path name come from?"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-01-06 00:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could we do something like create a subdirectory for the existing content and moving it into that and then putting the new content into a subdirectory next to the old content? Something like:

<dir>/results-001
<dir>/results-002
...'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-01-11 21:14:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The only case when this error can occur is if there are 2 report requests that have the same mandatory user supplied strings used for the filename (in this case the directory name for the html output). The conflict only appears if the same string is supplied, since that is appended to the temp dir path and passed to the coverage module for html_report generation. The error is being thrown from the coverage module which is handling all the file and dir creation. This patch is really meant to handle the coverage module just throwing an error if the directory already exists.

I guess that there could be some weird edge cases if multiple users are requesting a report be generated with the same directory name if we just delete the directory out right. It's probably better to not delete the directory on conflict.

A better solution would be to return a 400 or some other error code with a better error message if there is a path conflict. Right now it'll fail with a 500 because of the exception. I'll re-push this to return an error with a real message instead of just deleting the conflicting directory."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-01-11 21:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-11 21:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-01-04 16:34:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix directory conflicts with html output.

When calling html_report() if the output path already exists
instead of rewriting the files in the directory html_report
throws OSError: [Errno 17] File exists. This avoids this
issue by checking if  the directory exists beforehand and
deleting it.

Change-Id: I061534c9ce9977692a7fc98187c4797b2ed60ab2
'}, {'created': '2013-01-11 21:23:49.000000000', 'message': 'Handle directory conflicts with html output.

When calling html_report() if the output path already exists
instead of rewriting the files in the directory html_report
throws OSError: [Errno 17] File exists which leads to a 500
return to the api call. This commit avoids this issue by
checking if the directory exists beforehand and returning a
400 with an error message instead.

Change-Id: I061534c9ce9977692a7fc98187c4797b2ed60ab2
'}]
commit_message:
Handle directory conflicts with html output.

When calling html_report() if the output path already exists
instead of rewriting the files in the directory html_report
throws OSError: [Errno 17] File exists which leads to a 500
return to the api call. This commit avoids this issue by
checking if the directory exists beforehand and returning a
400 with an error message instead.

Change-Id: I061534c9ce9977692a7fc98187c4797b2ed60ab2

commit_message:
Verbose should not enable debug level logging

Fixes LP #989269

Currently setting --verbose in will still allow DEBUG level
message to be logged to python logger object. we need to check
for --debug first (set DEBUG level), then --verbose (set INFO
level) and if neither is set then set default to WARNING

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic9e3cb5979b2d7283552ad3a461870373f45a239

commit_message:
Move migration_create() to conductor

This makes conductor able to create migrations and changes the
uses of migration_create() from compute/resource_tracker.py to
point at conductor.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: Icd2288906fb03105b7a71f790353ae6d3dbaae62

[{'created': '2013-01-12 04:35:31.000000000', 'message': "swift-recon: Added oldest and most recent obj repl

I've been doing this with cluster-wide log searches for far too long.
This adds support for reporting the oldest object replication pass
completion as well as the most recent. This is quite useful for
finding those odd object replicators that have hung up for some odd
reason and need intervention.

commit_message:
swift-recon: Added oldest and most recent repl

I've been doing this with cluster-wide log searches for far too long.
This adds support for reporting the oldest replication pass
completion as well as the most recent. This is quite useful for
finding those odd replicators that have hung up for some reason and
need intervention.

Change-Id: I7fd7260eca162d6b085f3e82aaa3cf90670f2d53

commit_message:
Reject names with NULL characters

Unfortunately, SQLite truncates strings with null characters.
Additionally, XML pretty much hates them too.

Change-Id: Id9a8eaa27b841db6350d6959c202d3e3d6462b35

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-12 12:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-12 15:23:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

At this point I'd really like to see a refactor that takes all the quantum specific setup into lib/quantum and just calls out to configure_quantum instead of putting more things in stack.sh.

As a rule of thumb, a quantum specific change should have more lines changed in lib/quantum than stack.sh. If it's the other way, it's probably not right."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-12-12 19:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Yes, we already talked with sumit on a separate thread about the need to pull the quantum config code into lib/quantum.  Sumit said he was interested in doing this anyway, so the urge to get floodlight support into devstack may be a good forcing function to finally getting this clean-up done.  

Sumit, how about swapping the order as Sean suggests?'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-12-14 05:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Sean, I fully agree with you that a refactoring is required for the quantum related code in stack.sh. However, that is a larger effort and will hold up integrating this patch which is much smaller. I think it would be much more beneficial to the FloodLight community to have this patch available right away, than have to wait for the bigger changes to come through first. I believe this was the reason Dan W and Gary K agreed with me submitting this patch in the first place. Hence I would request you to reconsider your stand. There also seems to be support for merging this patch from some of the other reviewers.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-14 13:00:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Sumit, I'm still -1 on any stack.sh complexity added by another quantum plugin.

I get that everyone wants to have all their subprojects supported in devstack ASAP, but if we don't do this cleanly, it's really hard to maintain.

My experience is if we don't eventually draw the line, no one does the refactoring. So I'm drawing the line here. If you can convince other devstack core folks to +2, that's cool, I won't block it, but I'm not +2ing any more quantum patches until the quantum logic is moved out of stack.sh and into lib/quantum"}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-01-04 18:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-01-04 18:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-01-04 18:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I have refactored the patch to align with the quantum refactoring, stack.sh is untouched in this new patch, changes are confined to the quantum modules.

Thanks to Akihiro MOTOKI for for submitting the earlier quantum refactoring patch and making it possible to align this patch per the wishes of the reviews.

Kindly review.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-04 19:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

commit_message:
Upgrade WebOb to 1.2.3

The version of WebOb being used in OpenStack was more than
1 year old. This change updates to the latest stable release.

Upgrading WebOb resolves a version conflict between OpenStack
and Pecan, the web framework used by the Ceilometer team for
version 2 of the ceilometer API.

Refer to http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html
for the list of changes between 1.0.8 and 1.2.3.

bug 1092227

Change-Id: I2c8e95ecc3b69b40fd9f8d2f801e75c17b07ed59
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
zmq-receiver msg forwarding in greenthreads

Because PUSH sockets can block and there
may not be PULL consumers, the oslo-zmq-receiver
process may stall in certain senarios.

Improves error handling in ZmqProxy.

This addresses bug 1097856.

Additionally, this bug seems to improve
(but not necessarily fix) the behavior
reported in bug 1065532.

Change-Id: I6df6035a6676c5bcdddaec7a332ac77e621ba9f3

When pinging your own floating ip, the snat rule is not hit if
dnsmasq is set up to give out an external gateway.

Fixes bug 1096259

Change-Id: Ib71312bf37b3a890567cf6212acabb5821846ab8
'}]
commit_message:
Allow pinging own float when using fixed gateway

When pinging your own floating ip, the snat rule is not hit if
dnsmasq is set up to give out an external gateway.

Fixes bug 1096259

Change-Id: Ib71312bf37b3a890567cf6212acabb5821846ab8

commit_message:
Fix lintstack check for multi-patch reviews

Some patches in gerrit depend on other patches that are not yet
approved, i.e. not yet landed on master. In this patch lintstack
deals with these cases by currectly generating the right commit
to compare against to further reduce pylint errors.

Part of bp/lintstack

Change-Id: I77622a44949ad2b442d9f2cce6c807e1581830c7

commit_message:
Log when release file lock

We log when waiting for a file lock, when getting one, so lets log when
releasing one.

Change-Id: I1838c424fda74c04e9c2107db08226670e8372f3

commit_message:
Simplify version processing.

In response to the cessation of per-commit tarballs produced by the CI
systems, simplify the version processing code. We did many many many
complicated things to support producing release artifacts that were not
actually supported release artifacts. After a bunch of issues emerged, it was
determined that the best way forward was to stop producing quasi-not-really
non-release tarballs. If people want to consume versions of openstack that
are not released versions, the git repos are always available.

Additionally, this patch removes versioninfo and just uses PKG-INFO and
pkg_resources to handle version processing.

Change-Id: I5c799f3520adb2ba5288d852543706d81a92f8a1

commit_message:
xenapi: Remove dead code, moves, tests

Related to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

Some changes to improve the quality and readability of the existing
code, and to help introducing a clean volume driver concept.

remove:
    dead sm code
move:
    volumeops.introduce_sr -> volume_utils.introduce_sr_unless_present
    volumeops.forget_sr -> volume_utils.forget_sr_if_present
rename:
    volumeops.connect_volume -> _connect_volume
    (to communicate, that it is an internal method)
add tests:
    volumeops.disconnect_volume

Change-Id: Ie5457c3d7823ed77f7ad90252d0c16558e8cfb4f

commit_message:
Add service_destroy to conductor.

This patch adds a service_destroy method to the conductor API.  It is
used from nova.service for deleting the service record in kill().  If a
service has been marked as not having db access, the conductor API will
complete this operation via rpc.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ie2397a090290823c0a47aaea41f6900072d142b4

commit_message:
Make nova.service get service through conductor.

Update nova.service to get a service record through the conductor API.
If a service has been marked as not having db access, a remote conductor
method will be invoked to get the service record.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ib701b1111eb4532c7a31d0099b7cb8c01def1935

commit_message:
Add service_create to conductor.

This patch adds the service_create method to the conductor service.  It
also updates nova.service to use it.  When a service has been marked as
not using the db, it will invoke a remote conductor method to create the
service record.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ie1f2db96d3134b0e30230565e5c000c416ea73d5

commit_message:
Handle waiting for conductor in nova.service.

Previously we were waiting for conductor to respond to a ping() in the
compute manager.  This patch moves this down to the base Service class.
A nova service binary can indicate that db access is not allowed and if
so, as soon as the service gets created, it will block while waiting for
conductor to respond.

The compute service has been updated to use this.  This should not
result in any real functional difference.

The reason for this is that there is some database access that needs to
be avoided down at this level.  This allows us to divert these actions
to conductor if needed.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Idd6387b9428e3f9f4e4dbfe51293693238b2daf0

commit_message:
Allow forcing local conductor.

This patch updates the conductor API to allow passing in a kwarg to
force local usage, even if configured for remote usage globally.  This
is useful if we want to convert some parts of the code to use conductor
db proxy APIs, but want to optimize usage to be local for cases where
using the db directly is not a problem.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ib7a717e1a6f132022787626e65cacaa8a4afd86c

commit_message:
Make pinging conductor a part of conductor API.

This patch moves the loop that pings the conductor over rpc until it
responds to be a part of the conductor API.  This will allow it to be
used elsewhere in the code as needed.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ie027adef4a3af3059b4ab586e927c93ae1a86fe9

commit_message:
Fix some conductor manager return values.

A couple of methods in the compute manager were returning a db model as
the result of an rpc.call().  Since db models all contain non-primitive
types, this will cause failures in the rpc layer.

Related to bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I6e4af99bd75e4a367bdc83b969ed4d8252f69ba2

commit_message:
Fix the case of CONFIG_FILE and FLAGFILE not being in the env.

When the first key error is raised by the lack of CONFIG_FILE
the FLAGFILE key is looked up, but if that one also does not
exist it seems like the better approach would be to just use
no configuration files instead of exiting with a KeyError due
to the lack of the FLAGFILE key.

Change-Id: I904de78c615a36359a0c7d76b3ec28501915413f

[{'created': '2012-12-19 20:14:17.000000000', 'message': "Configurable exec_dirs to find rootwrap commands

Adds support for a configurable set of trusted directories to search
executables in (exec_dirs), which defaults to system PATH. If your
filter specifies an exec_path that doesn't start with '/', then it
will be searched in exec_dirs. Avoids having to write multiple
filters to care for distro differences. Fixes bug 1079723.

Also returns a specific error rather than try to run absent executables.

Change-Id: I62a1d946b813aa97f9d094b4e6e2e72837f8faec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Configurable exec_dirs to find rootwrap commands

Adds support for a configurable set of trusted directories to search
executables in (exec_dirs), which defaults to system PATH. If your
filter specifies an exec_path that doesn't start with '/', then it
will be searched in exec_dirs. Avoids having to write multiple
filters to care for distro differences. Fixes bug 1079723.

Also returns a specific error rather than try to run absent executables.

Change-Id: I62a1d946b813aa97f9d094b4e6e2e72837f8faec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

No, I was just thinking that it was on pypi. But if that's not possible, well, too bad but that's not a blocker."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-20 03:23:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'd write down the discussion about the resize corner case on the IRC. Although I don't think that will block this patch, but keep it in record, and  even a bug to track, will be helpful.

The issue discussed is, if resize to the same host happen to a instance , after the cache is setup, the cache is not invalidated. Resize to other host will be a different topic.

I think there are several options to handle such situation.

a) Get notified when resize started. Only if (the time from  resize start to resize take effect in VMM) > (the time needed for the notification be received), there will be no race condition .

b) In current implementation, seems a new instance will  be re-created. So if the inspector can detect such situation, it can handle such situation, thus will be more clean and no race condition.

However, theory speaking, it's possible that VMM can do the resize without re-create the instance. For example, only memory difference between two flavor, and the VMM support virtual memory hotplug. But I don't think nova will take such tricky situation.

Any idea?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-12-28 14:54:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The resize issue yunhong-jiang brings up is a good point. I don't know about using events to invalidate the cache, since this code runs in the compute agent, which doesn't currently listen to notifications."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Only hit nova-api on previously unseen instance

Previously the public nova API was hit on every compute polling
cycle to retrieve the instances for the current host.

Now we use the virt inspector to check if the current set of
running instances include any unseen ones. In that case, for
example after a new instance is spun-up or a suspecnd instance
has been resumed, the instance cache is refreshed via nova-api.

Change-Id: Iacd72ea8a557d80ee22202e85a0ad68cf965afa1

[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-03 15:59:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The following information belongs in the commit message (likely rewritten for better clarity):

ZeroMQ teardown is broken and/or has race conditions (TCP sockets don't close quickly and can be async -- a known issue on Unix/Linux systems); Thus, we increment the port number used.

I'd like to supplant this patch with an alternative one with better socket closing, but that concept may be at odds with the thread-safety issues we have encountered with ZeroMQ sockets."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-01-03 15:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Address test_zmq setup/teardown races

Each test now consumes a new port number (9500+),
and socket directory based on an auto-incrementing
global counter (TESTCNT).

Also makes minor cleanup to test receiver setup logic.

fixes bug 1096223

Change-Id: Ie6a88c535c81f2fc12b97d32c2674a6184325d2a

commit_message:
ZeroMQ cast() pooling / waiting

Because cast() spawns a greenthread and casts
are not delivered until a remote host consumes
the message, Python could exit before cast() completed.

This patch puts the greenthreads for cast into a
GreenPool which is waited on upon cleanup()

Introduces new configuration variable,
rpc_zmq_max_concurrent_casts, to set the maximum
number of greenthreads to spawn for sending casts.

Fixes bug 1097927

Change-Id: Ib328ac975a7c8b738d93e07e44e6ce7a65c27f96

commit_message:
Add import for filesystem_store_datadir config.

Adds a missing CONF import for the filesystem_store_datadir.
This is required in order to make the policy tests (test_policy.py)
run as a stand alone suite.

Fixes: NoSuchOptError: no such option: filesystem_store_datadir

Fixes LP Bug #1098670.

Change-Id: If8f9db3962b070e7841e4e3ef531dda4645624b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-11 18:44:50.000000000', 'message': 'Skip domains on libvirt errors in get_vcpu_used()

This commit is to avoid a race condition between deletes
and creates. It is possible for a delete to remove a domain
from the list returned by _conn.listDomainsID() while
get_vcpu_used() is looping over the list. If this happens
libVirt raises a LibVirtError and sets the instance to the
ERROR state. To avoid this LibVirtError is caught and the loop
continues instead of raising the exception.

Change-Id: I3206142e36726936013bb27ccd4359de4f94b3a3
'}]
commit_message:
Skip domains on libvirt errors in get_vcpu_used()

This commit is to avoid a race condition between deletes
and creates. It is possible for a delete to remove a domain
from the list returned by _conn.listDomainsID() while
get_vcpu_used() is looping over the list. If this happens
libVirt raises a LibVirtError and sets the instance to the
ERROR state. To avoid this LibVirtError is caught and the loop
continues instead of raising the exception.

Change-Id: I3206142e36726936013bb27ccd4359de4f94b3a3

commit_message:
Adding guest agent pkg unit tests and running them with testr

Added unit tests for reddwarf.guestagent.pkg module.
Added tests for package install, remove and version
Changing the test runner of unittests to be run by testr instead of probocis/nose
Remove probocis reference from the dbaas test
Moved dbaas.py to reddwarf/tests/unittests

tracked by bug #1090139

Change-Id: Ia25fbe996d04d39e83edef0369de0e7fccce579e

commit_message:
adding ubuntu vmware performance options to doc

With these options it will allow you to make builds with kvm emulation
instead of qemu.

Bug 1098329
Change-Id: I95ff6979e82b7a7a3160855ab9db1d5e0c68fc65

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-09 03:52:35.000000000', 'message': "Ignore origin/HEAD branch during local_prep.

In the image update script ignore the 'origin/HEAD -> origin/branchname'
branch returned by `git branch -a` as the entire string is not a valid
branch (so it cannot be checked out). origin/branchname should be part
of the list returned by `git branch -a` so this branch will get covered
even when we ignore origin/HEAD.

Change-Id: I47852ffd6e25fe3a29a1b310142c5614ca5a6fa9
"}, {'created': '2013-01-10 21:12:41.000000000', 'message': "Ignore symbolic references during local_prep.

In the image update script ignore any branch returned by `git branch -a`
containing the ' -> 'substring. This entire string denotes a symbolic
reference and is not a valid branch (so it cannot be checked out). We
can do this safely because `git branch -a` will also return the branch
referred to by the reference.

Change-Id: I47852ffd6e25fe3a29a1b310142c5614ca5a6fa9
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore symbolic references during local_prep.

In the image update script ignore any branch returned by `git branch -a`
containing the ' -> 'substring. This entire string denotes a symbolic
reference and is not a valid branch (so it cannot be checked out). We
can do this safely because `git branch -a` will also return the branch
referred to by the reference.

Change-Id: I47852ffd6e25fe3a29a1b310142c5614ca5a6fa9

01ab910 Fix set_default() with boolean CLI options
af18eaa Improve cfg's argparse sub-parsers support
f21e1d9 Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments

updated due to the changes mentioned above. The downside is that these are
not backward compatible. Unknown arguments are no ignored. Only bound
arguments will be treated.

Thanks to Mark McLoughlin for migration cli code changes.

Change-Id: Ia776e78cc55f4ed33ace5efa8d726b70e3fa4131

commit_message:
Port to argparse based cfg

Implements blueprint argparse-based-cfg

Sync the following changes from oslo-incubator:

479f19c Add deprecated --logdir common opt
27b2ff4 Add deprecated --logfile common opt.
9b81289 Allow nova and others to override some logging defaults
3557d84 Fix ListOpt to trim whitespace
01ab910 Fix set_default() with boolean CLI options
af18eaa Improve cfg's argparse sub-parsers support
f21e1d9 Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments
ceb4aa7 Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts
5e9503b Hide the GroupAttr conf and group attributes
b6d24bb updating sphinx documentation
403509e Don't reference argparse._StoreAction
e17deb8 Fix minor coding style issue
0c29e1d Remove ConfigCliParser class
5b9cb41 Add support for positional arguments
dbc72a6 Use stock argparse behaviour for optional args
768a147 Use stock argparse --usage behaviour
ac180b9 Use stock argparse --version behaviour
0787e38 Remove add_option() method
5afead0 Completely remove cfg's disable_interspersed_args()
5f564b2 argparse support for cfg
d7b6397 Add a missing comma in a docstring.
aca1805 cfg: fix required if option has a dash

Note: various utilities/services with command line parameters needed to be
updated due to the changes mentioned above. The downside is that these are
not backward compatible. Unknown arguments are no ignored. Only bound
arguments will be treated.

Thanks to Mark McLoughlin for migration cli code changes.

Change-Id: Ia776e78cc55f4ed33ace5efa8d726b70e3fa4131

commit_message:
NvpPluginException mixes err_msg and err_desc

In a few places err_msg was passed to NvpPluginException though that
expected err_desc. This patch makes NvpPluginException take err_msg
instead and updates err_desc to err_msg when calling NvpPluginException

Fixes bug 1098351
Change-Id: I10eca5f2b98ce8faa81ad7c7687902b6f08752c1

I'm not sure how it's attached for libvirt?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-10 02:33:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

-1 pending response to questions."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Chris, exposing it as a CD would be good, but it turns out it is harder than you would hope.

I originally claimed you can only have one CD per VM, turns out that is rubbish.

The issue is that to attach a VDI with a content type of ISO, currently that means it is a VDI in an SR of content type ISO. Unfortunately, there is no easy way to get ISOs to live on the same disk partition as the VHD files without messing around.

Here we get away with a VHD file containing something of ISO format, and the VM mounting that correctly, rather than having XenServer expose an ISO file as a device to that VM (the more normal way).

Thinking about this, we need to make sure when we attach the disk we set the vbd_mode=read_only

http://docs.vmd.citrix.com/XenServer/6.1.0/1.0/en_gb/api/?c=VBD

We could try setting vbd_type=CD to see if that makes things work, but given vdi_type will not match, I am not sure that will work.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-01-10 11:03:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think we need to attach the config drive disk in read_only mode, just to make sure."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-01-10 12:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For mounting it as a VHD here's what we do in the Hyper-V driver (in case it should be helpful for your patch):

1) ISO creation with genisoimage / mkisofs (configdrive.py, no changes needed) 
2) Convert from ISO to VHD with qemu-img
3) Attach the resulting VHD as IDE disk

As a side note: we added a flag "config_drive_cdrom" to mount it optionally as a CDROM instead of a VHD.
 
Please note that cloud-init on Linux doesn't support CDROMs yet. Attaching it as a VHD is also a slightly more secure approach as mounting it and accessing the contents requires root privileges.

In cloudbase-init (our cloud-init for Windows) we support both cases.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-11 00:08:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

John: Yeah, was thinking about it later, and I came to the same conclusion about it having to live in an ISO SR.  Bummer.

Alessandro: yeah, the code here does #1 and for #2 we create the VHD via XenAPI calls, attach it, and dd the ISO to it.  #2 is all fine and dandy assuming we're okay with this showing up as a disk with iso9660 filesystem.

I'm cool with this patch if we set read only.."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-01-11 05:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

@Mate -- thanks for the pointers on unit testing.

New version uploading now.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-01-11 05:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-11 05:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Adding configdrive to xenapi.

This version implements a configdrive v2 for xenapi as discussed
in the xenapi IRC meetings.

 - the config drive is now iso9660
 - the admin password is injected (if we know it)
 - vbd's are not reused
 - review comments have been addressed

Progresses blueprint xenapi-config-drive. DocImpact.

(Dear documentation people, if using config drive with xenapi,
the user should consider disabling the agent as well with
xenapi_disable_agent. This mostly depends on if they want to
support post-boot password updates still.)

Change-Id: Ib23d117ad4cd5dc92298a0812eb468f7d557417c

commit_message:
Correct the calculating of disk size when using lvm disk backend.

Currently, disk space size calculating in nova doesn't consider the
situation when lvm is used as disk backend. Thus both used and total
disk size are not correct when we use lvm to create instance. This
patch fixes this problem by using 'vgs' to get disk size in such case.

Fixes LP #1098116.

Change-Id: I0e86649cfde83a154d0a4c034ca52abe73384e73

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-11 03:03:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix EXTRA_OPTS handling

In the conversion away from add_nova_opt the EXTRA_OPTS handling
inadvertently replaced all '=' chars in the value rather than
just the first.  Additional '=' is legal for an option value.

FWIW here is the setting that tripped it:
EXTRA_OPTS=default_log_levels=sqlalchemy=WARN,boto=WARN,eventlet.wsgi.server=WARN

Change-Id: I2deb139171250eb0ef5028bb924569cec31e1a4e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix EXTRA_OPTS handling

In the conversion away from add_nova_opt the EXTRA_OPTS handling
inadvertently replaced all '=' chars in the value rather than
just the first.  Additional '=' is legal for an option value.

FWIW here is the setting that tripped it:
EXTRA_OPTS=default_log_levels=sqlalchemy=WARN,boto=WARN,eventlet.wsgi.server=WARN

Change-Id: I2deb139171250eb0ef5028bb924569cec31e1a4e

[{'created': '2013-01-11 19:36:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix imports tempest imports for tempest_coverage.py

Currently you can't run tempest_coverage.py because of an import
failure when trying to import from files in tempest. This is because
the python path from tempest/tools doesn't include it's parent
directory. This commit gets around the import failure by changing
sys.path to the root tempest directory.

Change-Id: Iebbbbc1fbcf7f5fb0eb5d9dbdf3901cb77b90a43
"}, {'created': '2013-01-11 21:02:31.000000000', 'message': "Use '-m' for tempest_coverage.py in tox.ini

Currently you can't run tempest_coverage.py because of an import
failure when trying to import from files in tempest. This is because
the python path from tempest/tools doesn't include it's parent
directory. This commit gets around the import failure with tox by
using 'python -m' for the script.

Change-Id: Iebbbbc1fbcf7f5fb0eb5d9dbdf3901cb77b90a43
"}, {'created': '2013-01-11 21:10:58.000000000', 'message': "Use '-m' for tempest_coverage.py in tox.ini

Currently you can't run tempest_coverage.py because of an import
failure when trying to import from files in tempest. This is because
the python path from tempest/tools doesn't include it's parent

Change-Id: Iebbbbc1fbcf7f5fb0eb5d9dbdf3901cb77b90a43

commit_message:
Use '-m' for tempest_coverage.py in tox.ini

Currently you can't run tempest_coverage.py because of an import
failure when trying to import from files in tempest. This is because
the python path from tempest/tools doesn't include it's parent
directory. This commit gets around the import failure with tox by
using 'python -m' for the script.

Change-Id: Iebbbbc1fbcf7f5fb0eb5d9dbdf3901cb77b90a43

commit_message:
Adds 3 additional tests to test_flavor.py script

Adds three additional scenarios to flavor-manage functionality.
The test cases are added to the script test_flavors.py present in
"/tempest/tempest/tests/compute/admin" folder. Also adds try and
finally blocks to the already existing test cases.
Modified the "create_flavor" method in flavors_client.py and
made extra data as optional paramters instead of mandatory ones.

Change-Id: I8791dfc0cf1df6c1788b5c7e05f99e6eda989823
Implements: blueprint add-tests-flavor-manage

commit_message:
Amended basic installation docs.

Basic installation docs for compute, controller, and network inscructed the user to restart networking services out of sequence.
The sequence has now been amended so that configuration changes occur as intended.

Fixes: bug #1091855
Change-Id: If1728d7dcf19a72f0c30b93ac6857e1f20f28bf8

subject: Provide the meters unit's in /meters
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-19 20:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1064 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/1064 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/1066 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-folsom/271 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/271 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-20 02:31:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for the patch.

There are two options in the bp (I voted to option 2, the idea as this implementation), but after more consideration, I think option 1/2 majorly depends more on if the counter unit type changes dynamically and frequently.

If the counter unit will be static (i.e. the same counter name is sure to have same unit), possible we don't need the unit information in the counter. We can have a transformer to do the unit translation for different publisher, and we can have the API/storage layer to append the unit information to the request result by checking a mapping.

If the counter need be changed during the time, I think keep unit information in counter is a good idea, and we also need  update the API layer to handle different unit for same meter type.

Any idea?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-20 09:17:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Storing the unit inside the counter (and yes, duplicating) has a clear advantage of being really safe is anything change at some point. Storing the unit in a description in code or config is likely to fail as soon as one of the counter changes its unit.

(I didn't review the change yet, I will!)"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-20 09:56:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(15 inline comments)

Minor things to fix, especially not using prefixes and using unit everwhere.
I wonder if it wouldn't be a good idea to add a check in Counter() to be sure that unit is not null? I don't know."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-20 10:07:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IRC seems broken, so comments here. If we keep the unit information, then when we do the max/sum query in API, should that consider the unit also? I suspect it will make thing quite complex.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-20 11:17:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For API su/max/etc, I'd say we can just raise an error stating that there's different units in the time range asked so we're unable to process the request. That sounds largely acceptable to me."}, {'account_id': 186, 'date': '2012-12-20 12:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-20 12:55:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1075 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/1075 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/1077 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-folsom/282 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/282 : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-20 13:05:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

jd__, after back home, I considered this still. Just curios that currently we don't have any usage case clear, so why not postpone till the usage more clear and currently we can do the mapping in API easily. I think the first purpose, unit information in /meter API, is more important than second purpose, support variable counter unit.

If we keep all counter as static unit (SI, e.g.), and add the unit when the usage is more clear. Then it can still easily detect that if there is no unit in the counter, it's SI, otherwise, we can get unit directly and can meet the benefit you mentioned in IRC.

Any idea?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-20 13:14:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm thinking about another benefit.

If we store unit, we can have 2 identical counters (same name) with different unit, and that would be nice.

Let's say you want to have the total amount of incoming network trafic. Currently we have 2 different counters, one for number of packets, and one for their size. That's the object we are counting, but that's just different aspect of it which are different units.

So we could image storing this as one counter name 'network.incoming' with 2 differents units (bytes and packets), then you could request:

GET /meters/network.incoming/sum
=>
[
  { unit: 'packet', count: 2312321 },
  { unit: 'B', count: 2932102321 },
]

GET /meters/network.incoming/sum?unit=packet
=>
[
  { unit: 'packet', count: 2312321 }
]"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-21 08:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-21 09:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1084 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/1084 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/1086 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-folsom/291 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/291 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-21 16:48:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-12-28 18:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I don't have a problem with including the units in the data published for each meter. However, I don't think we want the units to change for a given meter name, and I don't think we want to support multiple units for the same meter. Both of those options makes the work of aggregating the values significantly more complicated. We can't, for example, just add up all of the numbers using a database operation without checking that they all have the same units. The benefit of having the API do unit conversion doesn't seem to be greater than the new complexity of that error checking.

I think we need some naming conventions established, too. I see "instance" and "B", for example. Should "instance" be plural? Should "B" be spelled out as "byte" (or "bytes")? Should all of the meters that count resources have the same unit, something like "resource", instead of using the resource type name?'}, {'account_id': 186, 'date': '2012-12-29 14:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-29 14:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/3/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1109 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/1109 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/1111 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-folsom/316 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/316 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-31 13:01:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Doug: having the unit changed on a counter is not something that you're going to avoid since the protocol doesn't have any check of that. It's just something we'll need to take into account API wise. I'm not talking about conversion, we don't want that. We just want to raise an error if someone ask for a sum/avg/whatever on a time range where the counter have different unit, that's it. :)

B is the SI abbreviation for byte, so it's fine to me. We can also stick to the fullname.

Using resource for other might be better indeed. :)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-12-31 16:35:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Julien, if we add the units to the meter data then we have to deal with what happens when it changes. If we don't add the field, then we don't have to add the check, right?

What benefit do we get from including the units in the incoming meter data?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-12-31 16:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

gpernot, in the future please don't rebase your changes in the middle of a review. It makes it very difficult to figure out what has changed from one patch to the next. If a merge fails, then you can rebase at the end after the code is approved, and only make changes needed to get the merge to succeed."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-12-31 16:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm OK with using standard abbreviation for units, when available.

I also like using the resource name, instead of the more generic "resource", for counting units like "instance" and "ip". The way you've added those looks pretty consistent (all lower case and singular).

It feels a little weird to allow bad data in, and then generate an error when the user tries to query it. I think before I approve a change that stores the units in each measurement, I would have to see how the error detection could be implemented without killing API performance. That work can be done in another changeset on top of this one, so it can be reviewed separately.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-01 11:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The check is just a matter of doing:

assert 1 == (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT counter_unit) FROM … WHERE …)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-02 16:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The check is pretty simple in SQL. A little less so in Mongo, but not too bad. I'm worried about scanning the data twice in both cases, though. I suppose we could do the calculations and "group by" the unit value, then if we get multiple responses raise an error.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-03 10:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

I think the patch is good, except for the documentation."}, {'account_id': 186, 'date': '2013-01-03 11:33:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-03 11:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/4/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1112 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/1112 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/1114 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-folsom/319 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18413/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/319 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-03 20:23:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm convinced we do need this, and we can make the error detection work. Are you going to submit a separate patch for that work?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-04 09:25:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:
