- http://logs.openstack.org/18018/3/check/gate-quantum-python27/2759 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't see any issues with the code. 

I haven't been involved in the client side of this review, but In general, I'd prefer that the API avoid such automatic type conversions.  

Is there some reason the API needs to convert from None to empty string, rather than giving the client a way to specify the empty string and reject None as an invalid value for something that is a string?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

"action=clear" in client is prepared to set an empty value explicitly.
Before introducing action=clear we had no way to specify an empty list [] explicitly.
Thus I do not prefer to changing the meaning from "clear" to "default" .

I agree it is useful to provide a way to reset an attribute to the default value, but we need to consider carefully which value should be used to default the value.
If None is used to reset to the default, we need to provide another way to specify an empty list [] in case a default value of the list is other than []. Another example is "gateway_ip". In case of gateway_ip, None is used to specify "empty" and the default value is the lowest address of a subnet.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A word "clear" seems to be used in two meanings: the one is to "set an empty valuee" and the other is to "reset to default".
These are different operations and the former is more important.

Regarding setting an empty value, it is important to provide a way to specify an empty value since some attribute may have a non-empty value. API should not limit a value which is valid for the attribute.
A concrete value of "empty" depends on its format: "" for a string, [] for a list, {} for a dict.
(There were many discussions about gateway_ip None. gateway_ip is not a string but an IP address, so we choose None as "empty" value.)

On the other hand, do we need to reset a specific attributes to the default value?
Once an resource is created, each attribute has some value and
if we can set any valid value to the attribute a way to reset to the default is not necessarily required.

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17441/ was originally intended to provide a way to specify [] (an empty list) for
dns_nameservers and host_routes, but during the review action=clear is introduced and the meaning of "clear" changed.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Maybe we should change it to default instead of clear. I think that it is useful to have a way to set values back to their defaults and may make life easier for the user of the CLI.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

We need to resolve this treatment on the ML'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There is an open patch in the client that allows fields to be cleared: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17436/
This patch enables that to be supported.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I know the client allows it, but I'm not sure we want to allow character fields to be null.  Seems like this could break the way people expect the field to behave.  Also, I'm not sure that we need two ways to clear a field."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I caught a tiny nit."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17436/ is nest coffee,
This patch is its sugar and milk.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

If we accept None is part of API. Now, API allows some attrs missing, which will be treated as None in DB when resources are being created (when default is missing in attr map too). But we cannot reset these attr as None again after that. That is to say, API fails to allow the resource back to initial status.
In addition, We need a simple and consistent way of resetting  the attr to initial default value. Allowing None as an indicator of doing this seems reasonable and practical. Quantum cli is not a only client of API. We can spend efforts on quantum cli side setting default value attr by attr, but we cannot expect other users of the API do so too.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

the meaning of empty and default value should be different.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

VlanManager did not check to ensure that required params
where actually passed before proceeding with create, which
resulted in KeyErrors being raised when required param was
missing. This was causing confusing when nova-managed was
used to create network.

This patch adds simple checks to ensure those
are there and raise error when not passed.

Also makes minor modification to tests and adds new
test cases.

Fixes bug 1053814

Change-Id: I8e141d50e86eed52ba922a447f42396e80deb180
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure missing param raises error on network create

VlanManager did not check to ensure that required params
where actually passed before proceeding with create, which
resulted in KeyErrors being raised when required param was
missing. This was causing confusing when nova-managed was
used to create network.

This patch adds simple checks to ensure those
are there and raise error when not passed.

Also makes minor modification to tests and adds new
test cases.

Fixes bug 1053814

Change-Id: I8e141d50e86eed52ba922a447f42396e80deb180

[{'account_id': 894, 'date': '2012-12-14 12:56:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

There is a thing I don't understand.

The user that has PUT permissions can change container's metadata, so what is preventing the user to change the quotas?

I'm using a custom quota middleware, but I enforce the quotas at authentication level out of swift so the user can't change that."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-14 13:11:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-12-16 21:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Why not have quota at account level instead of containers?'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-12-16 21:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

and it would be nice if this is something that can be set from the auth middleware.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-12-16 22:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@chmouel, While I think that "real" quotas in an ISP sense would in fact be integrated with an auth system, I don't think that's what this implementation is supposed to solve.

My understanding is that this feature would be most used in a "I have a cloud storage account and don't want to scale above my [storage] budget" sense. It may also be used as a way to set limits on a drop-box-style container (eg I give you write permission to one of my containers).

This implementation would probably also be useful in private deployments (ie inside one company) where clients can be reasonably expected to "play nice".

I don't think this is intended to solve the "don't let me grow beyond my overall budget" problem. In that case, you would require a much deeper knowledge of both usage and billing information (including bandwidth).'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-12-16 22:59:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'll never really understand why people want quotas to be a function of authorization.  It seems so random.

We have no real use cases for account quotas, but we have several for container quotas.  We're gonna work on container bandwidth quotas too, and I'll share it if it's not too tied to our infrastructure."}, {'account_id': 894, 'date': '2012-12-17 08:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK, now I understand the use case to this middleware.

I guess what confuses me is that the classic meaning of quota is an imposed constraint that is enforced to the user (ie. you rent cloud storage space and it has some limits: quotas). In this middleware there's no enforcement because the user can change the quotas at will.

Although this is supposed to implement "basic container quotas", I miss that is supports a more Unix-alike quotas with a soft-limit and a hard-limit, but I understand there's no easy way to warn the user when is over quota (soft-limit) before the service is cut (hard-limit).'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-12-17 13:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This is exactly an imposed constraint that is enforced to the user.  Just it's set by the account administrator, not the provider.  Maybe it makes more sense in a public cloud setting, where provider-defined quotas make sense in a private cloud."}, {'account_id': 894, 'date': '2012-12-17 13:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

"This is exactly an imposed constraint that is enforced to the user. Just it's set by the account administrator, not the provider."

The user can update the metadata and set X-Container-Meta-Quota-Bytes to whatever he wants, thus disabling quotas. AFAIK even if you implement ACLs and the user has only access to that container, with rw access to it, the quotas are useless because again can be changed at will.

I may be wrong and I'm missing something, but I think this middleware doesn't provide the kind of quotas you're describing.

I'm sorry if I'm failing to explain my point.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-12-17 14:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Admittedly it has been a while since I last tested this, but I believe you have to have account administrator access or overall cluster administrator access to change anything regarding a container. Container read-write access should just let you put, post, and delete objects within the container.'}, {'account_id': 894, 'date': '2012-12-17 14:45:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

You're right, I've just verified that.

Sorry for the noise guys."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-12-17 23:10:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Doesn't work for me.

I uploaded a 6000 (6 KB) file, and then set its container to have a quota of 1000000 bytes (1 MB). I then tried to upload a 30 KB file, and got a 413.

It looks to me like there's some more stuff that needs to be int()ed; I think the middleware may be comparing ints and strings. I threw int() calls around everything I could find, and then the byte quotas worked like I expected."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-12-18 12:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-18 12:34:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-12-18 20:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It works, but I can't turn quotas off once I turn them on.

See http://paste.openstack.org/show/W3QrwYPRwuf67Rr5NRJt/ for my attempts at doing so.

(Yes, I can make it work with curl and X-Remove-Container-Meta-Quota-Bytes headers, but most users won't figure that out.)

Also, if I've got an object X in a container, and I upload a new version of X that's the same size, but that size is less than the available space in the container, I get a 413 even though the end result would still leave me under quota. That's not the end of the world, obviously, but it's something to consider.

Example (to clarify): 
$ swift post con -m 'quota-bytes: 10'
$ swift upload con obj      # 6 bytes, 200 OK
$ swift upload con obj      # 413 Requested Entity Too Large"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-12-18 21:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-18 21:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-14 12:47:37.000000000', 'message': 'Basic container quotas

Add a new middleware implementing some basic container quotas.

Quotas are subject to several limiations: eventual consistency, the timeliness
of the cached container_info (60 second ttl by default), and it’s unable to
reject chunked transfer uploads that exceed the quota (though once the quota
is exceeded, new chunked transfers will be refused).

However, they get most of the way to container quotas fairly inexpensively.

Quotas are set by adding meta values to the container, and are validated when
set:

  X-Container-Meta-Quota-Bytes: Maximum size of the container, in bytes.
  X-Container-Meta-Quota-Count: Maximum object count of the container.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I77cfbf6dc231a2e522bd67328e4c082424a93eed

commit_message:
Basic container quotas

Add a new middleware implementing some basic container quotas.

Quotas are subject to several limitations: eventual consistency, the timeliness
of the cached container_info (60 second ttl by default), and it’s unable to
reject chunked transfer uploads that exceed the quota (though once the quota
is exceeded, new chunked transfers will be refused).

However, they get most of the way to container quotas fairly inexpensively.

Quotas are set by adding meta values to the container, and are validated when
set:

  X-Container-Meta-Quota-Bytes: Maximum size of the container, in bytes.
  X-Container-Meta-Quota-Count: Maximum object count of the container.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I77cfbf6dc231a2e522bd67328e4c082424a93eed

commit_message:
Pin dependencies at specific versions

If someone were to build a new venv environment, they
would end up downloading versions of dependencies
that will not work with Essex.

This also fixes an issue in the OpenStack CI
environment, where unit tests were not running.

Problem originally reported in

https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1092372

Change-Id: Id256c258b120bc73855501ee2ee21ee751f0a430

[{'created': '2012-12-13 10:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add basic CW publisher support

Add transformer to convert from counter to Metric format.
Also add a fake publisher to log all converted Metric.

Now all data from nova is converted, with the cpu_util data
is not updated yet. Next is to add delta tranformer to achieve
it.

Some genric transformer is added, which is the base for CW transformers.

For bp: multi-publisher

Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add basic CW publisher support

Add transformer to convert from counter to Metric format.
Also add a fake publisher to log all converted Metric.

Now all data from nova is converted, with the cpu_util data
is not updated yet. Next is to add delta tranformer to achieve
it.

For bp: multi-publisher
Change-Id: I592e70f49b3c44e5fc9f9f8fea70f9a616de9786
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Move fixtures into their own dir.

We were accumulating a lot of fixtures in nova/test.py. Having a catch-all
location is kind of lame - so I moved them. Now we can start moving some of
them into oslo...

Change-Id: I01c0b61a98dc4331cf41172863beafba36b9a110

Verify the disk file exists before running qemu-img on it.

Should resolve bug 955788, although it is a little hard to tell
because the bug is so old.

Change-Id: Ic0c47f4b6181f56a98cf58d4ebe2cc926d06d524

commit_message:
Add basic quantum system tests into tempest based on quantum api V2

blueprint add-basic-quantum-system-tests

Add following basic quantum system test cases into tempest to leverage the openstack jenkin's infrastructure.
Based on latest quantum api V2

1, create tenants
2, create vms
3, create networks

Patch Set 2:
1) add tox support because of gate-tempest-pep8
2) repair the error ImportError: No module named quantumclient.v2_0.client

Change-Id: I59888600bebe1e5963e8f703011ca24e2bd07189

commit_message:
Adjust CINDER_SECURE_DELETE flag to cinder changes

Cater for the pending more general cinder support
for configurable volume wiping method at:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12521

This change is done here first so as to not
trigger a CI lockup when the referenced patch above lands.
When that's in place, we can remove the older
secure_delete config adjustment in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I73fe2e0d1cf2815ab6025121584951cb5ff56fa3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-27 01:18:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove availability_zones from service table

This is the final step in enabling availability_zones using aggregate
metadata. Previously all services had an availability_zone, but the
availability_zone is only used for nova-compute.  Services such as
nova-scheduler, nova-network, nova-conductor have always spanned all
availability_zones.

After this change only compute nodes (nova-compute), will have an
availability_zone. In order to preserve current APIs, when running:
* nova host-list (os-hosts)
* euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
* nova-manage service list
Internal services will appear in there own internal availability_zone
(CONF.internal_service_availability_zone)
Internal zone is hidden in euca-describe-availability_zones
(non-verbose)

CONF.node_availability_zone has been renamed to
CONF.default_availability_zone and is only used by the nova-api and
nova-scheduler. CONF.node_availability_zone still works but is
deprecated

DocImpact

Completes blueprint aggregate-based-availability-zones

Change-Id: Ib772df5f9ac2865f20df479f8ddce575a9ce3aff
'}, {'created': '2012-12-27 02:08:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove availability_zones from service table

This is the final step in enabling availability_zones using aggregate
metadata. Previously all services had an availability_zone, but the
availability_zone is only used for nova-compute.  Services such as
nova-scheduler, nova-network, nova-conductor have always spanned all
availability_zones.

After this change only compute nodes (nova-compute), will have an
availability_zone. In order to preserve current APIs, when running:
* nova host-list (os-hosts)
* euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
* nova-manage service list
Internal services will appear in there own internal availability_zone
(CONF.internal_service_availability_zone)
Internal zone is hidden in euca-describe-availability_zones

commit_message:
Remove availability_zones from service table

This is the final step in enabling availability_zones using aggregate
metadata. Previously all services had an availability_zone, but the
availability_zone is only used for nova-compute.  Services such as
nova-scheduler, nova-network, nova-conductor have always spanned all
availability_zones.

After this change only compute nodes (nova-compute), will have an
availability_zone. In order to preserve current APIs, when running:
* nova host-list (os-hosts)
* euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
* nova-manage service list
Internal services will appear in there own internal availability_zone
(CONF.internal_service_availability_zone)
Internal zone is hidden in euca-describe-availability_zones
(non-verbose)

CONF.node_availability_zone has been renamed to
CONF.default_availability_zone and is only used by the nova-api and
nova-scheduler. CONF.node_availability_zone still works but is
deprecated

DocImpact

Completes blueprint aggregate-based-availability-zones

Change-Id: Ib772df5f9ac2865f20df479f8ddce575a9ce3aff

commit_message:
Import latest timeutils from oslo-incubator

Fixes bug #1097464

Changes synced are:

 a08daf1 Use basestring instead of str for type check.
 615d769 Account for tasks duration in LoopingCall delay
 ce80aac Convenience wrapper for datetime.timedelta.total_seconds()

Change-Id: If4ab7ccd2f4e815e01c41f25fdd541ffcd7693d5

c) it surprises me that changes are needed to devstack. What does it need?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-08-06 19:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Vish,

a) should it migrate the old zone into metadata on upgrade?

Sounds good to me, I can make the availability zone entry in the service table optional as well.  How should the default availability_zone be done? Should I remove the service table based availability zone part of the filter?

b) Doing a db request in the az filter seems nasty, it seems like all of the aggregate metadata should be added to host state so it can be used by all filters.

Agreed, I will update this now.

c) it surprises me that changes are needed to devstack. What does it need?

This change removes the availability_zone parameter for aggregates, so a corresponding change needs to take place in the python-novaclient and devstack smoketests.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-06 19:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Enable Aggregate based availability zones

Instead of implementing availability zones in the service table,
availability zones are implemented using general aggregate metadata.

This patch does not remove availability zones from the service table, a
latter patch will do that.

* In theory supports a single compute node in multiple availability zones
* Drop availability_zone column from Aggregate table (is now a property)
* map aggregate metadata 'availability_zone' so API does not change

Implements blueprint aggregate-based-availability-zones

Change-Id: I2a2ac5bfaa526d639dff5efa392c051347dbd9bb

[{'created': '2013-01-07 17:12:42.000000000', 'message': "Use tempdir for lock_path in tests.

Commit: 2331d3336a6adf4fc13a3b187e91a5d1b1f7c723
introduced use of lockutils but wasn't setting a lock_path, in the tests.
As a result we were polluting cinder/openstack/ with cinder-xxxx lockfiles.

This patch adds a tempfile and cleanup to the test so we don't leave any
junk behind.

Change-Id: Idd9fee928ff0fcf3f8d1c30ee88c5306b88e290c
"}]
commit_message:
Use tempdir for lock_path in tests.

Commit: 2331d3336a6adf4fc13a3b187e91a5d1b1f7c723
introduced use of lockutils but wasn't setting a lock_path, in the tests.
As a result we were polluting cinder/openstack/ with cinder-xxxx lockfiles.

This patch adds a tempfile and cleanup to the test so we don't leave any
junk behind.

Change-Id: Idd9fee928ff0fcf3f8d1c30ee88c5306b88e290c

commit_message:
Move global glance opts into nova.image.glance

Move the glance_host, glance_port and glance_protocol options into the
nova.image.glance module.

Also move the generate_glance_url() and generate_image_url() utility
methods there since they're the only uses of the options outside of the
module.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I3beca1a65cdd902a94ddc1c512d79a4de635ef38

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 21:37:57.000000000', 'message': "Properly wait until volumes are gone in volumes.sh

A logic error in volume exercise's wait for volume deletion
causes the test to do the opopsite, and continue on even tho
the volume is in in the 'deleting' state.  If using a volume
backend that can quickly delete volumes (ceph), and the volume
is gone before entering the wait, the loop will spin, timeout
and fail the test.

Change-Id: I8e3d2aaa04e6a165e0dee32bedac97d35e13d5eb
"}]
commit_message:
Properly wait until volumes are gone in volumes.sh

A logic error in volume exercise's wait for volume deletion
causes the test to do the opopsite, and continue on even tho
the volume is in in the 'deleting' state.  If using a volume
backend that can quickly delete volumes (ceph), and the volume
is gone before entering the wait, the loop will spin, timeout
and fail the test.

Change-Id: I8e3d2aaa04e6a165e0dee32bedac97d35e13d5eb

commit_message:
Enable cinder exception format checking in tests.

Updates the Cinder test runner so that it enables
'fatal_exception_format_errors' for testing.

Includes a bunch of fixes to test exceptions as well so they
will continue to pass.

Change-Id: Idd30a810fb81e8e14490644779c3e03b6af25ff3

kwargs for proper exception message formatting. Previously

'}]
commit_message:
Update exceptions to pass correct kwargs.

Updates a variety of Cinder exceptions so that they pass the correct
kwargs for proper exception message formatting. Previously
these exceptions would work but have incorrect error messages
because of how CinderException handled exception formatting errors.

Change-Id: Id1d15b112cad46a698227fa172d81a9ab586e66e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-08 18:26:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to make exception format errors fatal.

Adds a new fatal_exception_format_errors config option which
defaults to False. This option is use to control how the base
CinderException class handles errors which can occur when it
formats error messages.

The motivation for this change is to be able to enable exception
format checking in our tests by setting fatal_exception_format_errors=True.

Change-Id: I2df952558d3f30a557cbb094f8bddcc37af9b5aa
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to make exception format errors fatal.

Adds a new fatal_exception_format_errors config option which
defaults to False. This option is use to control how the base
CinderException class handles errors which can occur when it
formats error messages.

The motivation for this change is to be able to enable exception
format checking in our tests by setting fatal_exception_format_errors=True.

Change-Id: I2df952558d3f30a557cbb094f8bddcc37af9b5aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-08 21:49:16.000000000', 'message': "Clarify the DBApi object in cells fakes

Adds a docstring and makes instance_get_by_uuid() raise by default.
It's only used as a stubbing point, but returning 'None' is not really
valid and having it raise might save someone some confusion in the
future.

Change-Id: Ie3fa333288f9c0263ead69c2d307101b8583dea7
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify the DBApi object in cells fakes

Adds a docstring and makes instance_get_by_uuid() raise by default.
It's only used as a stubbing point, but returning 'None' is not really
valid and having it raise might save someone some confusion in the
future.

Change-Id: Ie3fa333288f9c0263ead69c2d307101b8583dea7

This adds libvirt driver support for blueprint rebuild-for-ha

* extend list_instances() to return also defined domains
* adding flag of delete_disks to destroy()
* new api instance_on_disk which checks instance files
  accessibility

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add to libvirt driver instance_on_disk method

Added method to driver layer to validate that instance directory
accessible from the host.

part of libvirt driver support for blueprint rebuild-for-ha

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9c6a3aec99f61bd4fb6bc4b4264771e077aae96a
Co-authored-by: Oshrit Feder <oshritf@il.ibm.com>

subject: add to driver option to keep disks when instance destroyed

commit_message:
add to driver option to keep disks when instance destroyed

Adding delete_disks flag to destroy instance method.
In case it's false the driver keeps disks.
*required for blueprint rebuild-for-ha

DocImpact

Change-Id: I38c7833114d8414dff831c9cc0c04c4610dbd33a
Co-authored-by: Oshrit Feder <oshritf@il.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add support for generating coverage reports from tempest.

This adds support for tempest to generate coverage reports in nova
using the coverage extension.

Change-Id: I76f9f3109fbd8005fe3157f4b95f1dd036877613

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 20:51:35.000000000', 'message': 'fix N401 errors, stop ignoring all N4* errors

We had previously been ignoring all our custom N4xx hacking.py
errors. This fixes all the N401 errors "single line doc strings
should not start with a space" and reduces the ignore set down
to N402 only "single line docstrings should end with period".

It also fixes the N401 parser which would enforce on multiline
doc strings as well even though the error didn't say that's
what it was trying to enforce on.

Change-Id: I9040a1d2ca7efda83bd5e425b95d1408b5b63577
'}, {'created': '2013-01-04 21:12:45.000000000', 'message': 'fix N401 errors, stop ignoring all N4* errors

We had previously been ignoring all our custom N4xx hacking.py
errors. This fixes all the N401 errors "doc strings
should not start with a space" and reduces the ignore set down
to N402 only "single line docstrings should end with period".

It also fixes the N401 parser to catch only docstrings, and
not tripple quoted string blocks used later on in a function.

Change-Id: I9040a1d2ca7efda83bd5e425b95d1408b5b63577
'}, {'created': '2013-01-04 23:50:10.000000000', 'message': 'fix N401 errors, stop ignoring all N4* errors

We had previously been ignoring all our custom N4xx hacking.py
errors. This fixes all the N401 errors "doc strings

'}, {'created': '2013-01-07 12:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'fix N401 errors, stop ignoring all N4* errors

We had previously been ignoring all our custom N4xx hacking.py
errors. This fixes all the N401 errors "single line doc strings
should not start with a space" and reduces the ignore set down
to N402 only "single line docstrings should end with period".

to N402 only "single line docstrings should end with period".

Change-Id: I9040a1d2ca7efda83bd5e425b95d1408b5b63577

commit_message:
fix N401 errors, stop ignoring all N4* errors

We had previously been ignoring all our custom N4xx hacking.py
errors. This fixes all the N401 errors "doc strings
should not start with a space" and reduces the ignore set down
to N402 only "single line docstrings should end with period".

It also fixes the N401 parser to catch only docstrings, and
not tripple quoted string blocks used later on in a function.

Clean up a few of the more crazy uses of """ in our code

Clean up additional funky comments to make indents a bit more
consistent, and pull in lines when possible.

Change-Id: I9040a1d2ca7efda83bd5e425b95d1408b5b63577

it is easy-use that a user can specify name also as an image like nova
command(ex. "nova boot").

$ glance image-delete cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec

Fixes bug 1093380

commit_message:
Add image names to glance command arguments.

Now a user should specify ID as an image by glance command, and I feel
it is easy-use that a user can specify name also as an image like nova
command(ex. "nova boot").

By applying this patch, a user can specify name as image like the
following examples:

$ glance image-show cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec
$ glance image-update --name root-fs cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec
$ glance image-delete cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec
$ glance image-download cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec
$ glance member-create cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec 94b0e63a27ca43348fe056622fe3fe94
$ glance member-delete cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec 94b0e63a27ca43348fe056622fe3fe94

Fixes bug 1093380

Change-Id: Ia0a070eed6ae3853ef02032f479087edb1d75a67

Hi Leon,

the reason for which this patch is pushing files you have never touched is probably you have not developed your work on top of the LBaaS API patch in a way that this would be tracked in git history.

To this aim you might do the following:
1) checkout the API patch
2) cherry-pick you commit on top of that patch
3) re-push to gerrit (as the change-id will be the same you won't see a new patchset, but just another rev of the same patchset)

Step #2 will give you some conflict errors. This is because the LBaaS patch has progressed since you started coding the DB support. Accepting changes from the current HEAD instead of the ones from your commit should work for all conflicts.

Ping me on IRC or by email if you need assistance with this."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-01-08 22:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (13 inline comments)

A few more comments inline.
It seems you are missing some exceptions in quantum.common.exceptions - probably you did not commit the changes to it?'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-01-08 22:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

Most comments are nits, the code now is in a much better shape.

Regarding status management in the db class, it still look a bit weird to me.
For instance we have bits where the status is set to pending_delete and the the very next line the corresponding object is removed. 

Ideally in the real plugin, between these two lines there will be the dispatching of the command to the driver. And in that case it would be fine.
Hence I have the feeling that status management should be there,  not in the DB support class. But I won't make this a blocker - we can always come back to it at  a later stage."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-01-08 22:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
The change implemented Lbaas CRUD Sqlalchemy operations.

 - This change only contains the database access implementation
 of LBaaS API. There is no real configuration down to device
 side.
 - This change implements a loadbalancer plugin which doesn't
 do much thing but only db access. The object status needs to
 be updated when integrate with the lbaas agent.
 - This change follows the new LBaaS API 1.0 model. Please see
 the spec on wiki.

Implements: blueprint lbaas-plugin-api-crud
Change-Id: I1bccec8c29e3e9486506a5b52ce69af0480b2300

commit_message:
Fix baremetal VIFDriver

Commit Id287f7e661 removed the nova/virt/vif.py file and the VIFDriver
base class, and erroneously stated in its commit message that baremetal
driver did not use it. This patch repeats the work of that earlier patch
by removing the import of nova.virt.vif from baremetal/vif_driver.py.

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework

Change-Id: Ifac9510a72a028dc5d3574148f3c4a6410b1d249

[{'created': '2013-01-08 21:21:42.000000000', 'message': 'Support Option Groups in LazyPluggable

Sync a change from oslo:
https://review.openstack.org/18676

Let us check if the opt_name has a '.', if it does then split it
into a group/key and try lookup using that combination. Since
LazyPluggable uses "CONF[self.__pivot]" a lookup of
"baremetal.db_backend" will check the key inside the group

Fixes LP# 1093043

Change-Id: If6aff06e0601c62f54d2bc913a9ca63a791520a6
'}]
commit_message:
Support Option Groups in LazyPluggable

Sync a change from oslo:
https://review.openstack.org/18676

Let us check if the opt_name has a '.', if it does then split it
into a group/key and try lookup using that combination. Since
LazyPluggable uses "CONF[self.__pivot]" a lookup of
"baremetal.db_backend" will check the key inside the group

Fixes LP# 1093043

Change-Id: If6aff06e0601c62f54d2bc913a9ca63a791520a6

Use apt git package instead of git-core.

The git-core package is deprecated in favor of the git package. Use the
git package instead.

"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-10-25 18:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

While this is one potential way to fix it, it's not the preferred solution and it may introduce new bugs.

In general when we apply fixes to previous branches they should be backports of the fix that was introduced in master. If you look at what we're doing currently it's to simply code more defensively and use the "get()" method to specify a fallback if the key isn't found:

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/views.py#L74

That change was introduced here:

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/commit/155bfb72c1b5f866236928f4ffd0c2567dc556f3#L6R89

A similar fix should be backported.

It's also worth noting that this situation comes about because of a bug in Essex Nova where volumes returned by the API are not properly scoped to the current tenant. That bug in Nova was fixed late in Folsom.'}, {'account_id': 5969, 'date': '2012-10-30 10:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-30 10:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-25 00:42:03.000000000', 'message': 'Given all instances when listing volumes

The commit 9f581a8 added instance name for volume attachment when
list volume in branch stable/essex. But if a user has admin privileges,
the api.volume_list will return volumes in all tenants, so we need give
instances in all tenants in function get_volumes_data.

Because function get_instances_data and get_volumes_data does not use
the same instances, the function _get_instances is no need.

Fixes bug #1053488

Change-Id: I61736592efb23aea964b7fecdfe37c4890b5a423
'}, {'created': '2012-10-30 10:26:47.000000000', 'message': "Only show instance name or its id when listing volumes

The commit 9f581a8 added instance name for volume attachment when
list volumes in branch stable/essex. If a user has admin privileges,
the api.volume_list will return volumes in all tenants, but the user
only gets instances in the tenant which he log in. So we should only show
the user instance name or its id if we cann't get its name.

Fixes bug #1053488

Change-Id: I61736592efb23aea964b7fecdfe37c4890b5a423
"}]
commit_message:
Only show instance name or its id when listing volumes

The commit 9f581a8 added instance name for volume attachment when
list volumes in branch stable/essex. If a user has admin privileges,
the api.volume_list will return volumes in all tenants, but the user
only gets instances in the tenant which he log in. So we should only show
the user instance name or its id if we cann't get its name.

Fixes bug #1053488

Change-Id: I61736592efb23aea964b7fecdfe37c4890b5a423

commit_message:
Added local.sh script for devstack install.

Fixes blueprint:reddwarf-devstack-integration
(Integrate reddwarf into devstack -- under the reddwarf project)
  - Added a local.sh script that devstack can run that will install
    reddwarf.
  - This is a minimal install that includes everything needed to
    get a basic reddwarf-api and reddwarf-taskmanager up and running.
  - This doesn't yet include creating a guest image or booting up a
    guest image instance (use redstack for this for now).

Change-Id: Iad0f3fe3920ec086a96a7e506e0672a60f04f705
